text:
(2012 vintage)
Very dark red, almost black. Full and powerful, with a sweet yet smooth taste. Highly vinous, with plenty of dried fruit and some spices. Some barrel notes. Dry and lightly bitter finish. Medium body, and smooth mouthfeel. Overall, a great strong ale. Strong, tasty, highly vinous and quite smooth. More mellow than the normal version, but then again, this sample is 5 years old.

Aromat: słodki, zawiesisty i intensywny, rodzynki, suszone figi, daktyle i śliwki, karmel, toffi, likier. Pachnie wyraźnie i przyjemnie, są też wyraźne lekkie nuty beczki.
Wygląd: ciemnobrązowe, jasnobeżowa pianka, niewielka, szybko zanika do zera. Bardzo ładny miedziano brązowy kolor.
Smak: smak mniej słodki od aromatu, jest tu pewna owocowa wytrawność. Jest tu karmel, świeże, jasne owoce: winogrona i jabłka, od nich są te winne nuty. Dalej są suszone owoce: rodzynki, śliwki, figi, trochę czekolady, chleba i nut palonych dających lekką gorycz. Beczka bardzo wyraźna, dębina powoduje odczucie ściągania na języku. Na plus że brak lub mało tu mdłych typowych belgijskich melonowych nut. Dobrze ułożone, alkohol ukryty, tekstura gładka, aksamitna, piwo bogate, wykwintne i bardzo smaczne, wysoka nota za całokształt. 8/4/8/4/17.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2017 2012 Edition, bottled on 15/12/2015. From 0.33 L bottle; pours dark brown, nearly black with a very small, light brown head. Very malty aroma, dried fruits raisins and apple. Taste follows the aroma with a very light sweetness, heavy malty taste, much dried fruit, cask aroma, slight sourness present. Fruity and very long, slightly yeasty finish. Dry, full mouthfeel, soft to average carbonation (some more than the normal Pannepot, I had before). Very interesting!

Bottle (Pannepot Reserva 2012). Hazy brown beer with small beige head, ok lacing. Complex, deep aroma of vanilla, molasses, cherries, caramel, with notes of raisins, prunes, dried fruits. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter, light tart, raisins, cherries, prunes, dried fruits, some caramel and molasses, spices, wood, light vanilla. Medium to full body, oily texture, average carbonation. Finish is woody with notes of dried fruits. Fantastic, very complex, but for me not as great as other Pannepot variants because of too strong wood flavour.

33cl bottle thanks to SimonBlok. Vintage 2012. Pours a a pitchblack colour with a medium beige head. Aroma of dark malts, prunes, raisins, vanilla, oak, chocolade, caramel, figs. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter with a warming finish. Notes of dark malts, liquorice, vanilla, raisins, prunes, wood, slight roasted malt, wine, slight soy. Texture is syrupy, full bodied woth low carbonation

2012 Piwo czarne. Obfita, szybko redukująca się sycząca piana. Złożony aromat bardzo podobny do porządnego Risa. Wanilia, czekolada, wiśnie, rodzynki, daktyle. Piwo gęste i treściwe. Ciemne owoce i rodzynki. Delikatne nuty winne. I skodko i delikatnie wytrawnie. Alkohol schowany perfekcyjnie.

Flaska från Beergium.com. Vintage 2010. Mörk, mörkbrun, nästan svart med ett högt beiget skum med stora bubblor, som lägger sig ganska snabbt. I doften enorma mängder torkad frukt, kandisocker, plommon, russin och maltsötma. Liten antydan till blöt kartong och lite ålderstecken, men väldigt sparsamt. Stor och fortfarande ganska pigg kropp. Kolsyran är kvar. Inte lika söt i smaken som i doften. Fortfarande mängder av torkad frukt och stor maltsötma, men här finns även en ganska stor beska som väger upp. En del ekighet, nästan lite lakrits och anis tillsammans med typisk belgisk kryddighet och en torr, lite stram avslutning. Här finns lite brända toner i bakgrunden som ligger nära de torra ektonerna. Bra djup och komplexitet, samtidigt som den är ganska straight forward och efter förväntningarna. Viss tendens till ålderstecken, men förvånansvärt lite för sin ålder. Bäst före 2019 står det på flaskan, men känns som den skulle kunna ligga i många år till utan problem. Har en Grand Reserva från 2010 kvar, tror jag låter den stå ett tag till.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2017 Aroma&taste: hint of alcohol, some notes of solvent, sweetness, belgian-style spices, some sweet jam, maybe plum jam, dry fruits, notes of oak wood, vanilla, hint of something like dusty concrete treated by water (?). Complex and intense. Taste is sweet and a little sour too, like in plum jam.
Color is dark, head is weak and not very nice. Big bubbles.
Carbonation is high, though it was oak aged.
Im not a big fan of belgian style beers, but this one was... interesting.
One important note: the warmer this beer was getting, the finest aroma it has been had.

Piana ucieka bardzo szybko ze szkła, nie pozostawiając praktycznie niczego. W aromacie winogrona, drewno, delikatna wanilia, odrobinę dojrzałych, ciężkich owoców. Smakowo jest podobnie, z tym że jeszcze więcej posmaku winogron i owoców, trochę melasy, całość dość słodka (choć oczywiście nie zamula), na finiszu delikatne taniny i drewno. Całkiem przyjemne, ale szału nie robi

Kolor piwa jest brązowy z rubinowymi przebłyskami. Przy nalewaniu pieni się jak głupie, choć piana bardzo szybko ucieka przy akompaniamencie głośnego syku.
W aromacie czuć głównie ciemne winogrona, jak dla mnie one dominują całą kompozycję. Poza tym trochę suszonych owoców, fig. Poza odczuwalną nutą wanilii, całość, wraz z lekko wyczuwalnym alkoholem daje dość winne odczucie. Generalnie jest bardzo intensywnie, aromat jest wyczuwalny nawet po odstawieniu szkła na stolik. W smaku już takiej bomby nie ma, bo jest trochę melasowej słodyczy, trochę winnego kwasku, cierpkości na finiszu i to by w sumie było na tyle. Taniny na finiszu raczej na poziomie autosugestii. Alkohol zaczyna co nieco się wychylać za słodów i drożdży wraz z ogrzewaniem, intensyfikuje się też odczucie kwasku. Wysycenie jest dość wysokie, choć bez przesady, nie zapycha, jest też przy tym dość gładkie w odczuciu.
Wersja podstawowa smakowała mi jednak bardziej, wydawała się bardziej owocowa i ogólnie bogatsza.

Bottle 2010 at LuppoloStation (Rome). Thanks Fabrizio. Dark brown reddish highlights. Little lacing. Nose: figs, raisins, caramel, hidden soy. Mouth: oxidation is hidden, dry fruits, dates. Belgium on

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aromat - rodzynki w czekoladzie, alkohol, drewno lekka wanila; nie powala.
Piana - jak na coca coli, momentalnie opada i znika.
Kwaśnawe z lekko słodkim finiszem. Dość puste; jakieś suszone czerwone owoce i alkohol.

Great aroma with notes of oak, a bit of vanilla, dried fruits, a bit of fennols and wine-like red fruits. Taste is smooth, rather sweet with medium-low bitterness and again lots of fruits with a solid malty base. Fabulous beer.

Dark amber colour with almost no head. Medium intensive aroma of dark fruits, dark bread crust, hint of woody notes. Taste is medium sweet and medium dry with long duration dry finish. Fizzy carbonation. Medium to full body. Worth to try.

Pours dark, opalescent, big head, fast diappearing. Wild aroma, roast, sour fruits, vanilla, wood, cherries, plums, alcohol, ciconut. Smooth taste, roasty biterness with winish sourness. Fizzy, full bodied, thick, heavy.

Donker kleurig bier met een crème kleurige schuimkraag.

Aroma: vanille, zoet, drop, moutig.

Smaak: zoet, port wijn, mout, vanille, eiken en wat alcohol.

Heerlijk!

[2012] 33cl bottle. Dark brown, effervescent bubbles, and a foamy tan head. Flavors are raisins, plums, molasses, licorice, tobacco, oak and alcohol with spicy and vinous notes. Medium to full body, lively carbonation, oily texture.
Fizzy Brown, collapsing foam. Spicy sweet aroma, good dense mouth feel, a bit too sweet for the flavors it delivers. Overall a tad too sticky but a good warmer.

Appearance: Very dark brown. Fizzy, but almost no head.
Aroma: Dark malt, oak. Dark fruits.
Taste: Dark malt, dark fruits, slight oak. Vinous.
Bought: La Petite Brasserie (Fribourg), 330 ml, CHF 6.50
Info: 24/2-2017, BB: ??/??-????
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.
Bottle 33 cl. Deep red, with a min offwhite head. oak, spices, fruits. Bitter taste with a fruit and spice end.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2017 Brownish, small head, small gushing. Aroma: lots of cherries, candy sugar, bread, vanilla. Medium to full body, lots of sweetness. Flavour: toffee, cherries, plum, toast. Excellent finish: perfectly hidden alcohol, dark chocolate, some woody notes.

Bottle. Pours dark brown to black. Close to no head. Sugar, alcohol, some coffee, oak, bread, some orange flavour. Interesting. Sweet, with some lingering bitterness. Full body and soft carbonation. Good!

Veldig mørk brunfarge med lavt beige skum. Duften starter med banan og følges av kraftig lakris, marsipan og fudge. Lakris i smaken sammen med kaffe, mørk karamell og en del krydder. Behagelig alkoholsting i avslutningen.

Dark brown beer with a small white cup, low carbonation.
Drank a 2012 reserva versoin.
Taste is nice: malty taste, chocolate, cherry, alcohol, Fruity; dark fruits, plums, wood, winey.
Very tasty but ordinary Pannepot is even better.

Not my kind of beer but can definitely appreciate the quality here. Deep DEEP aromas of chocolate, tobacco, coffee, smoke, prunes, cherries, vanilla the list goes on and on. Same flavors. Just too sweet for my liking. Otherwise great.
2012 version, dark dark dark, with minimal head, aroma of figs and tart, portwine or sherry. Fine carbonation, very wineish, sweet dark fruits, i do not feel the 10%.

Bottle brought back from Bruges. Pours very dark brown with a quickly fading cream head. The aroma has black currant and wine. The taste has cough medicine, blackcurrant, spice, liquorice, red wine and oak in the finish. Some warming booze comes through.interesting and tasty.

Tap. Very deep brown color. Exactly 1 bubble tries to imitate head. Bloody hell give me another bubble and its gonna be as flat as teenager. Fruity, prunes, sweetish, sour, some alcohol in aroma. Belgian yeast, raisins, plums, fruity, roast in taste. Papery, yeasty, prunes and sweet in taste. Almost no carbonation. Feels like fermented old plum jam. And way too sweet for me. Solid brew.

Draft Third of a Pint at GBBF 2016 (Day 2), Olympia, London Aug 2016 - Opaque Dark Reddish Brown in colour. No head. No lacing. Very Fruity; dark fruits, plums, raisins, dates, figs, prunes, cherries. Spicy. Very Malty; dark malts, caramel, brown sugar, some chocolate, oak notes. Vinous mouthfeel, red wine. Sweet very fruity malty throughout. Complex. Enjoyed this a lot. Very Good! (2016-08-10)
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

2012. Minder dan de gewone Pannepot of de Special Reserva. Schuim is snel verdwenen. Erg sterk aroma dat doet denken aan een goede wijn. Maar met het schuim lijkt ook de geur wat te verdwijnen. Smaak van hout, drop en iets wijnachtigs.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 Dit is de 2012 versie. 
Fruitige neus. Smaak is bijzonder. Kers en blauwe bessen in combinatie met alcohol en kandijsuiker. Zoet, maar door het zure fruit komt alles mooi in balans. Zoet zurige afdronk.

Februari 2017, de 2009 versie. In aroma zit okkernoot/porto. In de smaak rozijnen, hazelnoot en kandijsuiker. Mooie zoet zurige afdronk.

Very dark with a deep brown head. Dark ripe fruit, cherry, chocolate, berries, dark malt, light tartness, faint tobacco. Full bodied. Amazing complexity. A very enjoyable experience. 2012 bottle drank 31DEC2016.
2012 Zwart bier met weinig schuim wat snel wegzakt. Smaak is krachtig, zoet en fruitig met iets van kersen, zoethout en pruimen.

12 vintage - Pours dark brown with brown hue and tan head. Nose is caramel, brown sugar, dried fruits. Taste is dates, figs, cola, chocolate. This is an example of why I dont drink Belgian strong ales made in America.

33cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bières te Dottenijs. U: Zwart met een donkerbruine schuimkraag die helemaal wegzakt. Ziet eruit als een glas cola na enkele minuten. G: Vineus, hout, gerooserde mout en gedroogd fruit. S: Zoet met een stevige moutbitterheid. Zeer veel vineuse toetsen in de smaak (voor mijn smaak mocht dit wat minder), eik en gedroogd rood fruit. Naar mijn smaak de minste uit de Pannepot-serie. M: Volmondig, licht sticky en medium carbonatie.

33cl bottle bought at De Roemer, Groningen. Appearance: dark brown with fairly big beige head. Head isnt very persistent. Aroma: Oak, vanilla, butterscotch, caramel, raisins, port, cocos. Taste: high sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of vanilla, oak, chocolate, cocos, dried red fruits, brown sugar. Alcohol is pretty well hidden. Palate: full bodied, oily texture and fizzy carbonation. Fantastic!

Caramel rietsuiker aroma. Knapperig sprankelend met een caramel kleurig schuimkraag die snel weg trekt. De perfecte combinatie! Sprankelend in de mond prikkelend in de afdrond diep en complex met hinten van port, caramel, hout, kersen, zurig. Een prachtig mooi samengeweven complex geheel dat lekker lang plakkend in je keel blijft hangen (bijna hoestdrank achtig).

From 330ml bottle. Pours dark brown, little head despite being quite dizzy at first. Aroma is sweet winter fruits and malts. Tastes of prune, dandelion and burdock, port, oak and sweet caramel. Quite a complex and lasting finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 from Uba ja Humal in Tallinn (was around 6-8 euros). Pours reddish brown with initially big yellowish beige head that fizzes away leaving nearly nothing. But damn, the aroma. Superb... dark baked and dried fruits... figs and dates and apples, apple skin and caramelised sugar, and even a bit of chocolate, slight vinegary notes, port wine, wood and raisins soaked in wine... so nuanced! Tastes very sweet, fermented fruits (the usual suspects, plus a bit of old strawberries), caramelly notes (almost burnt caramel), toffee somewhat, woody and tanninic dryish in the finish. Fizzy but fine carbonation, medium body, excellent drinkability and covered alcohol - theres only a nice soothing warmth after downing half. Wonderful stuff, although falls short of mindblowing... I guess for me its pretty much on par with the rest of the best strong Belgians Ive had.

2012 vintage from tap at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam. Aroma is massive figs, sweet dried fruits, malt, caramel, oak, toffee, raisins, some booze, Port wine. Flavour is very sweet and a bit boozy. Body is full. Exquisite rich and sweet oaked strong ale.

Vintage 2012. Robe brune bien sombre et mousse qui en gush aucunement, Dieu en soit loué! Arômes de figues confites, de dattes, dépices sèches, de clou de girofle et de muscade râpée. Je sens, malgré lintensité des arômes, que le temps a fait son oeuvre. En bouche le corps a certainement perdu de sa complexité car le liquide est ici plutôt mince. Saveurs de raisin séché et de fruits confits mais sans réelle profondeur. Il me faudra certainement déguster cette bière à nouveau lorsque fraîche car cette version vieillie de bientôt 5 ans a certainement connu des jours glorieux.

2012 edition. 33cl bottle at home from Biernavigatie.nl. Nose is dried fruits, light champagne. Body is black, head is medium, brown, long lasting heavy fizzy, fully lasting, fair lacing. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malt, dried fruits, cocoa, herb liquor, molasses. Medium to heavy sweet, medium bitter, light fruity sour. Finish is long lasting roasty fruity medium bittersweet, medium alcohol warmth. Full body, slick texture, first fizzy carbonation 5 minutes later flat. Bit heavy dessert beer, rich flavor, very tasty, Ive never seen a beer being fizzy such long, great one.

Bottle.
Dark reddish-brown. Aroma: berries, vinegar, oak, Taste: multi-layer, sweet beginning, berries, oak, warming alcohol, some hops in the middle, sour finish. Nice!
Flesje thuis gedronken. Zwart bier, matig schuimend. Aroma van caramel en fruit. Smaak is ook caramelachtig en zoet. Smaak ebt snel weg. Zwaar bier om rustig van te genieten.

Bottle. Opaque black color with small tanned head. Aroma has caramel, ripe fruits, oak, malt. Taste is malty sweet with quite long a bit sour and sweet aftertaste. Flavors of ripe fruits, malt, oak, cherries, caramel and raisins. Well balanced and tasty.

piwo z rocznika 2012. Aromat suszone owoce, wanilia, burbon, karmel, przyprawy, rodzynki, drewno, śliwki, alkohol. Kolor czarny, nieprzeźroczysty. Piana beżowa, znika w momento. W smaku słodkie, pełne, kremowe, słód, karmel, rodzynki, suszone śliwki, burbon, drewno, lukrecja, czekolada. Wysycenie wysokie.

Bottle @ bus w senior. Appearance: pours cloudy brown with ok short-lived beige soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: brown sugar, prunes, dried fruits, alcohol, spices, vanilla and oak. palette: strong malty and yeasty aroma, low to average carbonation, full body, medium to distinct sweetness, somewhat balanced by a medium bitterness, medium to long duration and an oily texture. Overall: Excellent oak strong ale.

Very deep-brown body, close to black, with a light-brown head that reduces to a partially covering film and a ring of foam along the walls of the glass. Malty and strong aroma of dark caramel, pleasant Belgian yeast, dark dried fruits and fortified wine, and a background of wood, vanilla, sugar and honey. Strong flavour of sweet caramel, dark caramel, Belgian yeast, dark dried fruits, fortified wine, wood and brown sugar, upon a background of vanilla, banana, bubble gum and honey. Full body, smooth texture, moderate carbonation. A delicious brew indeed! 
[33 cl bottle, 2010 edition, enjoyed 2 years after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Online]

Jolie robe ébène avec des reflets de couleur carmin et une mousse beige très éphémère.La carbonatation est intense.Le nez nous offre des arômes très subtiles de malts grillés ,fruits confits,vin cuit et épices de tabac...La bouche nous amène sur une douce amertume mêlées à des notes "piquantes" ,toujours à limage du nez.La finale est exceptionnelle,nous laissant sur ce velouté très chaleureux par lalcool et tout cet ensemble de saveurs harmonieuses."Earned the Iron Man badge"like in Black Sabbath!!!!!

Dégustée dans un verre Maredsous.
Température dé début 10° environ.
Magnifique robe ébène surmontée dune mousse beige effervescente qui disparaît très rapidement; carbonatation intense.
Nez particulièrement subtil avec des senteurs de pruneau, de vieux vin cuit, de vin grands crus bourguignons et de réglisse.... plus une imperceptible note chocolatée.
Le goût est du même calibre : réglisse avec une multitude de saveurs de fruits macérés et dalcools "vintage" le tout dans un sublime équilibre entre lamertume et la douceur.
La finale très longue ajoute la chaleur de lalcool et une douceur infinie ...
Une réussite absolue et une véritable "Madeleine de Proust".
Shared with wim at his home. Dark brown colored beer with small off-white head and no carbonation visible. Malty roasted winey aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is malty roasted bitter fruited.

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. 2012. Pours brown with brown-yellowish head, disappears quickly. Aroma: sweet, almonds, nuts, bourbon, butterscotch, rye, Taste: sweet, something sour, caramel, butterscotch, rye,muscat, freshly baked bread, warming alcohol in throat, milk chocolate.Full body. Smooth to drink. Well hidden alcohol. Sweet finish. Nice.

Bottle. Pours an opaque reddish brown with an initially thick but fading light beige bubbly head. Aroma is of dark fruits, raisins, figs, blackcurrant, caramel, liquorice. Taste is of more dark fruits, liquorice, caramel, hint of chocolate, plum. Sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

330ml bottle (Koht, Tallinn) 2012 Vintage
Big sweetish belgian strong ale aroma, malty, a bit of wininess, some burnt raisins. Dark, very little head. Lighter in the mouth than expected, theres a gentle tingle of carbonation, but then a lovely barrique-influenced flemmish red sourness, pops out and puts a smile on your face. Balance between the heavy and the light, the malt and the lis, the sweet and the sharp, is just right. Doesnt show its strength either, so a bonus point for that. This is my kind of beer.

Keg @The Salt Horse, Edinburgh. [Rating Backlog:Aug 2016] Pours brown with a red tinge. beige head which went quite quick. Nose is wonderful, Christmas cake, cloves, spices (mixed), big cinnamon, fruity, prunes plums, raisins, amazing nose. Taste is caramel, vanilla, spicy but not as much as the nose, sweet fruits, candi sugar taste, this is great. Wife had some and then bought some for herself.

Brune très foncé. Peu voir pas de collet. Nez: Sucre cuit. Caramel. Mélasse. Confiture de fraise/ petit fruit/ bleuet. Bouche: riche. fruité à fond. Confiture. Jus de pruneau. Crème de cassis. Sucre cuit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep brownish black from the bottle with thin ring of bubbly tan head. Aroma of faint oaky vanilla and big booze, hint of dark fruit. Taste is almost like a barrel aged stout with hints of dark fruit and Belgian yeast. Really nice.
Liquid is black as night, large, brown head. Light peaty aroma of malt. Medium body, little bit carbonation. Taste is sweet, chocolate.

Bottle 330ml (2012)  cellared for 4 years. Served at room temperature. Pours a dark, murky brown with a ruby tint. Head is small, tanned and average lasting. Aroma is strong and complex with notes of aged red wine; toasted wholemeal bread, dried currants, dried cranberries, blueberries, old wine barrels, cooked brown sugar, aniseed, 5 spice powder, pouch tobacco, and dried leaves. Flavour is immensely complex, smooth, and very vinous; aged red wine (strong), blueberry toast (strong), tart blackberries (strong), blackcurrants (strong), dried cranberries, toasted caramel, Belgian candy sugar, old wine barrels (strong), anise, dried leaves and a oak tannins in the finish. Full bodied with soft carbonation, an oily texture and an ambrosial finish. ABV is extremely well hidden. Easily one of the most complex and refined beers I have had to pleasure to taste.

Aroma: sweet dark ripe berries, prunes and cherries. 
Flavour: full dark fruity sweetness with notes of oak. A port like quality with a dry bitter finish and a warm fruity mouthfeel. 
Colour: very dark reddish brown with a reddish brown fading head. 
From: Bottle, bottled 2012, sampled Sept. 2016.

Bottled: Oct. 2012, Sampled: 8/30/2016.

Opaque, dark brown with a thin caramel head. Aromas of dried fruits (plums, dates, figs), caramel, herbs/spices, toasted bread, and honey. Arrives on palate with subtle dried dark fruits and caramel; develops a vinous, slightly tart, herbaceous, earthy middle and then moves into a finish of dark+milk chocolate blend & licorice. As it warms, the fruits and chocolates take center stage while still giving the wine notes some space at the end. Medium to light body with soft carbonation; quite lively for an old bottle! Smooth and rich in flavors while maintaining a balanced palate; excellent level of complexity throughout. Alcohol is very well hidden over its long glass life. Its tart middle shows off a lot of the French oak influence. Overall a pleasure to drink. This is a beautiful beer that achieves a nice blend of Belgian strong dark ales and French red wines.

Bottle. Reserva 2010. Dark brown with a beige persistent head. Aroma is complex, with notes of raisins fruit, spices, molasses, chocolate, toffee, caramel and roasted malts. Taste follows the same. Very well balanced. Less vinous than the standard Pannepot and even better than that.

2012. 
Aromat: Bardzo silne nuty beczkowe, waniliny, drewno, trochę przypraw, delikatne skojarzenia z winem + aromat cukru trzcinowego z butelki, który wprost zniewala.
Wygląd: Ciemne, z momentalnie opadającą pianą redukowaną do zera.
Smak: Analogicznie do aromatu (zwłaszcza beczka), lecz nasze kubki smakowe mogą doświadczyć dodatkowo smaku dojrzałych owoców (śliwki, morele, nawet figi), likieru (wiśniowego?) oraz wspaniałego, długiego finiszu spod znaku cukru trzcinowego. Alkohol ułożony jest wręcz perfekcyjnie, ujawnia się tylko po ogrzaniu pod postacią przyjemnego rozgrzewania w przełyku. Piwo zdecydowanie warte każdej złotówki.

330 ml bottle, 2012 vintage
Dark brown beer with beige head. Quite strong calvados. Woody as well. Also the obvious dark belgian strong ale flavors and aromas like dark sugar, plums, figs, cherry and dried fruits. Some cough surypy tones. Full palate, not too foamy. Very complex. Gets better with sediment.

330ml bottle. 2012 vintage. Black-brown colour with a beige foam head that dissipates away. Aroma of dark fruits, roast malt, red wine, woody oak. Taste is roasted malt, sweet, molasses, dark fruits, chocolate, dried fruits, raisins, port, wood, oak and some spicy bitterness. Silky smooth mouthfeel, medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, dry oaky bitter finish. Very drinkable.

2012 bottle. Was totally wasted by the time we opened that beauty but have blurry memories of another excellent Belgian strong with rich notes of dark and dried fruits, smooth mouthfeel with wine qualities. Great stuff!

Brun très foncé, tire peut-être sur le rouge. Mousse brune claire, presque orange de tenue très courte. Nez très puissant de prune, fruits secs, cerise, soutenu par le grillé du malt, note de tabac. Impression dun digestif fruité. Attaque douce de fruit confis, fruit sec, prune, vin sec (Porto). Arrière bouche de toast, malt grillé, chicorée. Petit effet stout avec note de cacao, chocolat noir. Fin de bouche amère. Vieillissement en fût peu envident quant aux notes de chêne. Alcool très bien masqué, impressionnant. Texture presque huileuse, corps plein. Carbonatation moyenne. Bière de garde brune très complexe, balancée et maîtrisée.

Very dark brown with a red hue. Tall light brown head that dissolves to a thin layer. Some lacing. Plum, cherry, tobacco, rum and much more in the aroma. In the taste the roasted/burned bitter flavours are more forward. Overpowering if served too cold. At Warmer temperature a fruity sweetness, almost like a desert wine, takes center stage. Quite different from anything else i have tasted.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2010: PE 24.9.2016. Vaahtoaa hieman ja jättää aavistuksen beigeä vaahtoa oluen pinnalle pitkäksi aikaa. Syvän tummanruskea olut, ei jätä pitsiä. Tuoksu karamellisen maltainen, tumman hedelmäinen ja luumuinen, vaniljainen, suklainen, todella viettelevän houkutteleva. Maku on yhtä lailla balanssissa huikean tuoksun kanssa. Makean maltainen, tumman hedelmäinen, suklainen, aavistuksen salmiakkinen ja mausteinen. Täyteläinen ja makea suutuntuma, paahteinen jälkipuolisko. Aavistuksen karkeampi varsinkin jälkimaun puolelta kuin Reserva 2009. Loistava! Keskenään vertailtuna (2009 Reserva & 2010 normaali) jälkimmäiselle piste enemmän ulkonäöstä vaahdon takia, Reservalle taas piste enemmän pehmeytensä ansiosta.

Deep brown. Hazy. Moderate off-white head. Perfect lacing. Multi-layered aroma with dried fruit, prune, port wine, fruity acidity, smoke, peat, nuts, barrel. Medium to full body. The taste is splendid. No words to define the most of it. Certainly dried fruit. Nice fruit acidity. Dark chocolate. Oak barrel (not much of). Alco well hidden. Light bitterness. Just unique and near the ideal.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2016 Bottle, 330 ml, vintage 2012. Pours almost opaque dark red/brown with a rapidly dissipating tan head. Some medium sized carb bubbles visible near and on the surface. Sugary sweet, cake-y malt on the nose with a lot of stuff going on alongside - big notes of cherry, raisins/dates/dried dark fruits, cognac, milk chocolate, muscovado, nuts, dark rum, tobacco, all more or less competing for attention at the forefront. Behind this we have the wood, vanilla, and spices from the barrel aging coming through fairly modestly for now, not overtaking everything like in an Innis and Gunn brew. Smells more and more like a cognac over time. Taste is sweet to begin with with much more chocolate, specifically cocoa/drinking chocolate coming through, and more of a nutty, roasted malt character with some coffee and more of those cognac flavours. Alongside this theres dark fruits again - not as prominent than on the nose but quite juicy and sweet - and spicy, estery belgian yeast emerging before the finish - which is fairly abrupt, dry and with mild lingering dark malt bitterness. Body is medium-full and texture is moderately thick and super smooth - carbonation is fairly soft. Brilliant stuff and a must-buy for cognac fans!

Pours a dark black color with a robust tan head. Aroma of dried cherries, dried dates, candi sugar, toffee, wood, tobacco. Similar flavor profile. Lots of cherries, sugary sweetness, molasses, some gentle woodiness. Characteristic Belgian Strong esters are present and in full force. A hint of warmth from the alcohol. Soft velvety mouthfeel, slick and sticky finish. Good carbonation. One of the best.

Its Pannepot so cant go wrong. ;) The woody dry backbone is an extra...or not. For me its still weird that i like the base beer better. Especially because i think the Pannepot Grand Reserva is sensational...i guess the Calvados oak vessels round that one out.

Rocznik 2012. Aromat intensywny, słodkie owoce, suszone owoce, wanilia, burbon, karmel, przyprawy, rodzynki, drewno, alkohol. Kolor ciemnobrunatny, mętne. Piana beżowa, średnio obfita, drobna, szybko redukuje się do cienkiej obrączki, zdobi szkło. W smaku słodkie, pełne, kremowe, słód, owoce, cynamon, karmel, rodzynki, suszone śliwki, burbon, drewno, lukrecja, czekolada, rozgrzewający alkohol. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie średnie. Fenomenalne.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2017 Piwo lekko metne w kolorze brunatno-pomaranczowym z refleksami. Piana znika niemal natychmiast po przelaniu do szkla. W aromacie beczka, lekka winnosc, suszone owoce typu rodzynki, sliwki i brazowy palony cukier trzcinowy. W smaku wysokie wysycenie i srednia dosc ziolowa goryczka. W smaku troche slodko, duzo owocow czerwonych i lekkie nuty prazonych slodow. Bardzo gladkie i wypelniajace pozostawia dlugi i intensywny posmak drewna w ustach. Alkohol bardzo powoli rozgrzewa gardlo. Trzeba powoli sie delektowac zeby go docenic.

Apperance: Dark copper, brown. No head
Aroma: raisin rum flavours, light oak
Mouthfeel: medium full, medium carbonation 
Taste: raisin notes, rum, plum, alcohol on aftertaste
Reserva 2012, uit de fles geschonken. Aroma en smaken van mout, gedroogd fruit, rood fruit, chocola. Mooie volle smaak met een heerlijke afdronk. Topbier!

Barwa ciemnobrunatna, piwo jest klarowne. Piana jak na coli, zniknęła błyskawicznie. Aromat jest złożony: czuć karmel, suszone owoce, przede wszystkim wiśnie, śliwki, rodzynki, są też nuty beczkowe i likierowe. W smaku dominują ciemne owoce, jest też lekko kwaśne. Faktura jest bardzo gładka, przyjemna, wysycenie jest dość wysokie, alkohol prawie niewyczuwalny. W ustach zostają długie posmaki, trochę beczkowe, trochę wiśniowe.
Almost black with a small off-white head. Aroma is cocoa, chocolate and malt. Taste is raisin, chocolate and coffee.
Brown color, hazy. Dried fruit aromas, caramel, spice and oak. Taste of dried fruits, yeast, brown sugar, spices, oak and light alcoholic finish. I prefer the standard Pannepot, still a great beer!
Dark brown with a light colored foam. Nuts, dark fruit, and a variety of sugars from light to burnt make this a complex and delicious beer. Fabulous.

These Belgians are definitely very goods. This Pannepot is sensational, all complexity is observed in every single sip, which should be done in a prayer ritual!! Maturing in barrels actually provides a very interesting differential... It should be sipped in silence and alone. Selfishness, I should say. KKKK
brown, black, clear, minimal head, brown foam, licorice, raisin, roasty, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, soft carbonation,

Bottle vintage 2012. Pours an almost Black, Dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma has lots oak, coconut, vanilla, bourbon, overripe fruits, caramel, toasty malts, light roast. Taste is sweet, malty, caramel, oak, light toasty bitterness, light alcohol. Average carbonation and a medium full body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Dranken Verheyen in Poppel. The beer is hazy dark brown to black colored and has a creamy head, with nice carbonation. 
The aroma is very malty and soft spicy with also notes of dried fruits and caramel and some cacao is noticable. Smell of oak is nearly not noticable.
The taste is full bodied and sweet with hints of caramel and dark fruits, and changes into a light bitterness with notes of cacao, spices, coffee and some refreshing hops.
The finish is light bitter and long and leaves some nice warming alcohol. 
Just wow, but there is not much difference between the normal Pannepot and this one.
Versão 2010. Excelente. Muito saborosa e aromática. Encorpada, mas não é pesada ou enjoativa. Teor alcoólico muito bem inserido.

33cl bottle. Dark brown pour with a dark tan head and visible carbonation. Smells like apple brandy, burnt caramel, raisins, cocoa and chocolate. The taste includes all those notes, and, in addition, a bit of cola and milk coffee. Full bodied with medium carbonation and a sticky-sweet and roasty aftertaste. My favourite by quite a bit, from the Pannepot series.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2016 (2014) [8/2/7/3/12]
Marrom escura e avermelhada igual coca cola, esouma bege de pouca formação e persistência. No aroma malte, caramelo, uva passa, açucar queimado, doce, álcool perceptível. Paladar de dulçor intenso, leve amargor torrado. Corpo licoroso, quase sem carbonatação. Final reprisa o aroma e paladar, caramelo e malte predominantes, álcool em boas quantidades, longa persistência. Ficou devendo para a 2010 de longe, acho que essa deve ter sido mal armazenada, destoa muito do padrão struise.

(2010) Marrom escura e avermelhada igual coca cola, espuma bege de boa formação e persistência. Paladar de dulçor intenso, média amargor torrado. Corpo licoroso de média carbonatação. Final misto amadeirado, açucar queimado, bastante malte, aveludada, persistente. Muito boa.
UPDATED: JUL 5, 2016 На биг крафт дэй 2016. Во вкусе карамел& шоколад. Весьма сладкое, но вместе с тем ощутимо спиртуо& послевк&

Aroma - alcoholic, dark fruit, rich brown sugar, and spice.
Appearance - black body, with a beige head that starts at 1" and fizzles out to a fine ring. Alcohol cloying.
Taste - dark fruit, alcohol, brown sugar, slight roast, and a slight Belgian yeast.
Palate - full body, sticky texture, lively carbonation, and slightly alcoholic astringency.
Smell is malt and mild alcohol. Taste is malt and Belgian yeast. Medium to full body, low carbonation, mild foam, and slight alcohol warmth.
UPDATED: MAY 28, 2016 Pours black, tan head. Aroma is malty, toffee, caramel, marcipan. Taste is balanced and complex, roasted, fruity, caramel. Very nice.

11.2 oz bottle (thanks Corbin!). 2012 vintage. Pours a deep Amber-brownish with an off-white head (exceptional considering the ABV and age). Nose is dried fruit, earthy, musty attic, woody, vanilla, minerals, mossy tree trunks, leather, tobacco, frankincense. Mouth is medium bodied, sweetness up front, prunes, leather, tobacco, grass, mushrooms, red clay. Complex.

Aroma: vanilla, dried fruits, roasted, bitter chocolate.
Appearance: amber color and no head.
Taste: dried plums, roasted notes, vanilla, barrel, smooth, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, vanilla finish.
Overall: Really good stuff, complex and tasty.

Botella. Presencia marron oscuro opaco con corona beige persistente y compacta. Carbonatacion baja. Aroma a caramelo, algo de cafe, y licor. En boca entra ligeramente dulce caramelosa con notas de cafe y frutos seco dando paso a intenso alcohol cafetoso y ligeramente amargo. Buenisima

Un marrone mogano intenso, schiuma fine e cremosa che è un piacere vederla, aroma intensamente maltato e delicatamente fruttato, ammorbidito da una vaniglia sontuosa e da un legnoso gentile. Corpo elegantemente strutturato, correttamente carbonato, nel quale il malto e le spezie la fanno da padroni. Non finisce mai, regalando fino in fondo sfumature preziose e delicate (coriandolo, legno, alcool, frutta rossa, caffè ).

330 ml bottle (2012). Dark brown colour, thin tan head. Sweetish aroma of dried fruits, banana, vanilla, notes of caramel and wood. The flavour is sweetish fruity, with berries, banana, raisins, dried dark fruits, vanilla notes. A little alcohol warmth in the finish. Complex, balanced, delicious.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2016 Bière brune à la robe sombre, elle présente une mousse crémeuse persistante. Au nez, on retrouve des senteurs chocolaté et avec de faibles notes de café . En bouche, on assiste à une explosion de saveurs : vanille, épices et fruits secs.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2016 On tap at hopaholic. Deep brown colour, almost black. Head disappears almost instantly looks like a sad coke. Nose is stron soy sauce, light molasses. Taste is medium bitterness light sourness. Molasses, ash, faint soy sauce. Almost no carbonation. Loved it the first time, just didnt cut it for me now.
Old rating: Bottle at home. Brown colour, very fizzy, head disappears almost instantly. Nose is oaky whisky like, definitve vanilla. Taste is mild sweetness definitve oak barrel vanilla. A well aged whisky like. Soma alcoholic warmth. Very nice. 8-4-9-5-18=4,4

2012 vintage. This is so intensely Belgian-y that it should have been named "Tintin and the chocolate waffles". It should come in a box painted the tricolors of the Belgian flag. It should be served exclusively from that odd statue of the peeing boy. Someone should insert the word "Pannepot" into the Belgian national anthem. This is a wonderful, wildly complex beer that has chocolate notes (obviously -- its Belgian) and a lot of sweet fruit and raisin notes. With Euro 2016 coming up, I now have lots of reasons to drink to Belgiums success.

Labeerynt 23.04.2016. W aromacie likier owocowy - przyjemna kompozycja suszonych śliwek, rodzynek, alkoholu i wanilii. W smaku owocowość z łagodnym winnym zacięciem. Gładkie i pełne a jednocześnie lekkie i pijalne. Bardzo dobre. Kolejny Belg przy którym miałem wrażenie, że mam do czynienia z autonomicznym rodzajem alkoholu.

Bottle (2012 vintage) from Cornelius. Dark brown body with no head or lacing. Aroma of leather, raisins, brown sugar and chocolate. Flavour of cherry, candi sugar and soy sauce. Thin to medium body with a slick texture. Light fizz. I expected much more - its not the nicest beer to look at, its surprisingly thin for the strength and it lacks the complexity of the finest Belgian beers.
2012 vintage. Dark brown pour with off white head. Aroma of prunes, caramel and raisins. Taste is semi sweet raisins, prunes and very slightly fruity, acetic notes.

Flaska från Etre Gourmete. 2012 Vintage. Mahognyfärgade, relativt klar, fräsande skum som snart försvinner. Doft av söt och aningen syrlig torkad frukt. Plommon, russin, körsbär, fat, fruktig likör. Mums. Fantastiskt gott. Perfekt avvägda smaker. Rejäl kropp med en hel del alkoholvärme, torkad frukt, med mycket torkade körsbär, russin, fat, fikon, christmas pudding. Lätt den bästa Pannepot jag druckit. Parfest till Brie med hemlagad plommonsylt.

Bottle. Trappist glass. Dark brown with tiny, light brown head, almost no head retention and lacing. Aroma is very complex - Ill find here everything - dark fruits, roasted malts, some licorice, sherry, light banana, woody, raisins. Strong maltiness - mainly bread and dough. Taste is medium bitter and lightly sour, strong oaky flavours are present, everything is broken by nice malty sweetness. Medium to full body, oily texture, rather lively carbonation finish is sour-sweet and heavy malty. In general this is real flavours and aromas bomb, lots of dark fruits, roasted malts broken by oaky sourness and characteristics. This beer is definetly worth trying, even not very experienced beer geek will find here all above characteristics.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2016 2012 version. Dark red with a tan head that fizzes away to nothing in seconds. Aroma of dried fruit, leather, strong bread, licorice, autumnal fruit, the forest floor. A bit Old Ale-ish, quite vinous. Chocolate and roasted flavours join the fruit and bread in the taste, which has a lot of malty depth but treads surprisingly lightly. Carbonation is fairly low. Warming in a slow, booming way - the alcohol is not disguised but is very well integrated. Wood and a slightly lean towards dry combine with subtle bitterness to finish. Theres a suggestion of other spices there too. Perhaps the next bottle will have a head. Great.
Botella del @Señor Lúpulo. Despacho de cervezas, Gijón 16/04/2016.Botella 2012. Color marron oscuro, sabor dulce, pasas malta.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2016 Pours dark brown with a tanned head that disappears fast. Aroma; Figs, dried dark fruits, alcohol, liqourice, vanilla, yeast, caramel and wood. Taste; Dried fruits, figs, nuts, herbs, vanilla, malt, wood, yeast and caramel

En aroma caramelo ciruelas y pasas
Buen aspecto con poca carbónatacion
En boca añejado en barril, ciruelas y regaliz

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Medium alcohol, coffee, oak, vanilla, Medium-light banana, licorice. Light sherry. 
Appearance: Hazy, black body with red highlights. Small, off-white head with fair retention.
Flavour: Medium licorice, molasses. Medium-light oak,Light banana, apricot, rose. Medium bitterness. Dry finish with lingering licorice.
Mouthfeel: Light warming. Medium body. Medium-high carbonation.
Overall: The licorice/molasses is quite one sided. Esters come in later, but still not adding a too much complexity. Overall a nice beer.

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
26D. Belgian Dark Strong.
Pff.Grosse tuerie boisé, vanillée, épicée, liquoreuse douce et maltée.Désolé cest court mais cest bon.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2016 
2012 version: 8/4/9/4/17

Aroma:

Medium heavy aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dark fruit, wood and vanilla.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/brown beer with a slight beige/brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dark fruit, wood and vanilla.

------- />
2010 version: unopened

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, wood, vanilla, dark fruit, chocolate and roasted malts.

Appearance:

Opaque dark brown beer with slight yeast and with a slight brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, wood, vanilla, dark fruit and chocolate; ends slightly bitter with roasted malts.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. The barrel aging and the many years between bottling and drinking, makes this beer darker; I presume. Could be the age, or a different recipe for the base beer.

330 mL bottle shared by ebone1988. Thanks! The pour is a dark brown, light black cola color with a thin fizzy cream colored head that sticks around with a foamy collar. There have any lace. The aroma is very woody and boozy right up front. There is a nice dark fruit presence, but it's just mostly booze and oak. There is a strong maltiness that's not too shabby. The flavor is a bit better. There is a nice paleness that's a little more reserved in the flavor. The alcohol isn't to dominant, but well balanced. The mouth feel is thinner and the carbonation is definitely fizzy and a little extreme. The aftertaste is nicely chocolatey and malty. This one isn't too shabby.

#900. Bottles shared with koleminer20 and Gus. Vintage 2012. Aroma is wood, figs, dark fruit, malt, bread, booze, complex. Appearance is dark brown, light tan, nice. Taste is woody, sweet, dried fruit, figs, dark fruit, no trace of booze, super complex. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy body, light carbonation, wood and bready fruit aftertaste. Overall, this is dangerously drinkable and I hope I can try original Pannepot now.

Bottle bought at Geers Oostakker.
Pours black with a dark beige medium head. 
Spicy, roasted malts, touch of wine, dried fruit, tannine, wood, butterscotch, warm alcoholic feeling.

Pullo @ Saveur-Biere. Kaatuu tulpaaniin todella tummanpunaisena, melkein mustana, noin sormen paksuisen vaahdon suojaamana, joka jättää reilun reunuksen lasiin. Monimuotoisessa tuoksussa on viinimäistä marjaisuutta, rusinaisuutta, puumaisuutta, vanilijaisuutta sekä makeaa hedelmäisyyttä. Vanilija ja makeus tuovat vaahtokarkin mieleen. Maku on edelleen hyvin viinimäisen marjainen, puumainen, makean sokerinen, rusinainen ja tumman hedelmäinen sekä hiven viinikumimainen. Suutuntuma on melko makea ja hyvin täyteläinen, alkoholi tuntuu lämmittävyytenä. Loistava ja monimuotoinen olut, josta on kypsyttämällä saatu jopa monimuotoisempi ja parempi kuin perusversiosta, joka on sekin loistava.
Bottle, 330 ml from Pivoljub. Shared with JFK10000. Pours dark brown, medium beige head. Sweetish, caramel, dried fruit, wood, walnuts, complex. Full bodied. Quite drinkable for abv. Really good.

Cest vraiment buvable !
Le nez est assez fin : assez caramel, des jolies notes de raisins frais, de prunes, de légères cerises et un fond boisé qui relève le tout.
En bouche : très sirupeux, un joli corps sans être trop présent, on retrouve très bien le nez avec en plus des nuances de pommes, de poires confites. Laspect fumé/boisé est bien plus tranchant et donne une sympathique acidité.
Vraiment un joli produit.

Bottle of the 2010 from Dranken Pauwels. Pours opaque very dark brown to black with a beige head which thins very quickly. Nose is big, fruity, rich and fragrant. Chocolate chip cookie dough, banana, ripe fruit, plum and prune, cocoa, dark chocolate, fruit cake, doughy bread, cinnamon. I could go on. How long have you got? Black grape, caramel, raisin. Taste is banana-ery ester, dark fruit, prune, stewed plum and peach, dark chocolate, little bit of aged second fill wood (something like port or little fortified vinous), little acidic on the palate. Slighted bitter roasted malt on finish which dries quickly. The nose on this is stunning but the finish is short and abrupt so this may be weakening in the bottle. As it warms up theres some cherry and Bakewell tart, almond on the finish too.

De eerste versie, Pannepot Reserva 2005 geproefd. Kastanjebruin bier met weinig schuim. Geur: aardbeienconfituur, 4 vruchtenconfituur, porto, cassis. Smaak: rozijnen stroop, kandij. Weinig koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: zoetig.

Aroma is toffee, caramel, vanilla, oak, dough, bread, toast, alcohol, dried fruit, so powerfull! Taste is sweet, caramel, vanilla, oak, licorice, light coffee and chocolate, alcohol (subtle) medium bittersweet finish. Ace beer, would love it if it where a bit more fullbodied.
Reserva 2012. My world what a beer. Im usually not a fan of 10% ales but this is so smooth, you only feel the high alcohol content for a brief moment after a sip, then its pure pleasure. Beautiful.

Jest to wersja piwa bazowego Pannepot leżakowana w francuskich dębowych beczkach (o pojemności 225L każda) 
 Ekstrakt:  24% wag. 
 Kolor:  Ciemnobrunatny z rubinowymi refleksami. Piwo jest klarowne. 
 Piana: Takiego syku i tak szybko uciekającej piany to nawet nie widziałem i nie słyszałem przy otwieraniu coca-coli.
Zmierzyłem czas. Minęło dokładnie 25 sekund od nalania, by piana całkowicie zniknęła z powierzchni. Trudno nawet było określić jej kolor czy strukturę.
Na ściankach nie ostała się nawet JEDNA pojedyńcza plamka. 
 Zapach:  Beczka, beczka i jeszcze raz beczka!
Ogromna moc dębiny, starego mokrego drewna plus intensywna wanilia.
W oddali śliwki, rodzynki i jakby rumowa nuta.
Słodka, owocowa nuta od razu informuje nas, że mamy do czynienia ze szlachetnym trunkiem. 
Delikatny alkohol podkreśla wagę tego pierwszorzędnego napitku. 
 Smak: W smaku nuty ciemnych owoców wychylają się jako pierwsze. Śliwki, rodzynki, suszone jabłka i ciemne winogrona.
Nuty beczkowe stoją troszeczkę z boku, ale wciąż jednoznacznie określają, że mamy do czynienia z dębiną i wanilią.
Po kolejnym przechyleniu Tumblera moje kubki smakowe łechtają karmel i toffi.
Po ogrzaniu uwydatnia się również winny charakter piwa.
Goryczka niska o owocowym natężeniu.
Perfekcyjny balans poszczególnych fragmentów.
Niesamowita gładkość, ale i treściwość.
Ogromna lekkość picia przy zaznaczonym, niegryzącym alkoholu.
Wybitny Belgian Strong Ale! 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  
Pannepot Reserva jest trunkiem wybitnym. I nie boje się wcale użyć tego słowa.
Intensywność dębowej beczki, wanili i mokrego drewna uczyniły z tego piwa wyjątkowe dzieło.
Ciemne owoce takie jak: śliwki, rodzynki, winogrona, suszone jabłka dodały odrobinę słodyczy.
Karmel, toffi i lekka winność dopełniły resztę.
Genialna lekkość, gładkość i perfekcyjne ukrycie alkoholu.

Pours a cloudy dark brown body with quickly disappearing head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, orange, alcohol and wine with notes of sulfur. Strong whiskey-like taste with notes of grapes, alcohol, chocolate and caramel. Medium body with thin texture and very recognizable alcohol.

Struise Pannepot Reserva 2012
WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemnobrunatna, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, krótka.
AROMAT: Średnio intensywny. Beczka (dębina), nuty winne (owocowe), przyprawowość, estry (jabłka). W tle alkohol - likierowy. 
SMAK: Bardzo owocowe (suszone jabłka), przyprawy i przyjemnie rozgrzewający alkohol. Spore nasycenie.
OGÓLNIE: Mega!

Aroma: Caramel, dark fruits, brown sugar, chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. Appearance: Dark brown to black, tan 1-finger head. Taste: Medium sweet, light bitter, very complex, very balanced. Palate: Full body, creamy slick texture, soft carbonation, long sweet finish. Overall: Basically the same as ordinary version of Pannepot although not so great, barrel aging does not help here in my opinion.

Reserva 2012. Extraordinary Belgian Strong Ale. Amazing barrel aroma, totally opaque and dark brown color. Maybe missing some foam. Taste is woody, concentrated malts, alcohol... somewhat bitter. Excellent carbonation levels. Maybe, my favourite Belgian Strong Ale so far.
When you open a beer is 7 years, filling the glass and beer testing and trips to a world of wonderful taste, no need to say anything more. The world is a fantastic beer in this part

Bouteille achetée Au Grain DOrge - Reserva 2012 - De couleur brune presque noire avec une mousse fauve qui redescend vite mais ne disparaît pas complètement - Au nez des arômes de sucre candy, de raisin sec, de figue, de pruneau, malté, caamel, torréfaction, chocolat, de vanille - En bouche du sucre candy, du café, du chocolat, de la vanille, du bois, légèrement fruitée (fruits sec), on sent bien le vieillissement en fut - Corp moyen malgré le degré dalcool, amertume moyenne, carbonation pétillante, douce et sucrée, final sucre et fruité - Excellent, tres douce, jai beaucoup de peine a cerné les houblons, mérite quelques année a la cave

Bottle from 2010. Aroma of port wine, chocolate, coffee, caramel and roasty malt. Dark liquid with a short lasting head. Medium-high sweetness followed by light-medium bitterness. Great great beer! The taste from the cask brings only good stuff to the beer. Average soft carbonation, full body, creamy texture.

Denne belgian strong ale har et mørkt udseende med et meget svagt skum. Øllen har en kraftig aroma af sød karamel, kaffe, chokolade, lakrids - nærmest en portvin aroma. Smagen er også intens af samme nuancer og har en god cremet fornemmelse. Lav karbonering.
2010 bottle at Vienna tasting February 2016. Many thanks! Clear ruby-brown colour. Quite a lot of caramel and sweetness in this one, but otherwise a pretty nice complex fruity experience. Good one.
Bottle. Brown color with small tan head. Roasted malt, banana, alcohol. Sweet malt, dark malt, banana, caramel, alcohol. Very good.

UPDATED: FEB 29, 2016 0,33l bottle at Vienna Tasting shared by Cuso, big thanks. Vintage 2010. BB 05/2019. almost black color, small tan head. smells peppery, dried fruits, light oxidation, light alcohol, marzipan. decent smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of dried fruits, marzipan, some alcohol, spices, some sweetness. finishes lightly sweet with some alcohol and notes of dried fruits and spices. Decent one, not overly complex not overly special. drinkable.

Bottle kindly shared by Cuso, many thanks. Dark brown pour with off white head. Aroma of prunes, caramel and raisins. Taste is semi sweet raisins, prunes and very slightly fruity, acetic notes. Very tasty!

33cl bottle from ABCBeers
Thick medium off white head. Clear black pour. Lovely complex smooth aftertaste

Dark brown colour. Modest head which turns into thin round of light brown froth. Rich and complex aroma - caramel, vanilla, hints of berries, coffee, raisins, wine. Caramel, coffee and wine at first. Berries, raisins vanilla. Hints of red grapes and some spiceness in the end. So rich palate. Very well balanced, rather medium bodied, absolute mindblower.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2016 2010 vintage at 10th Zythos Beer Festival in 2013. Aroma with notes of oak, caramel, dark fruits, vanilla and yeast. It tastes totally like a wine with notes of oak, raisin, caramel and yeast. Incredible. One of the best beer Ive ever tried. 10/5/10/4/18=4.7

May 22, 2016, at Jameys. 330ml bottle, vintage 10/2012. Pours a dark mahogany with a weak tan head. Aroma is oak, candied and dark fruits, cherries. Taste is really complex: oak, overriped cherries, dark and candied fruits. Oak, cherries aftertaste. 9/4/9/4/17=4.3.

Very dark, no head at all.
Sweet with a hint of licorice and caramel.
Not alcoholic. Slightly oily.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2010 vintage poured at room temp, roughly 65 degrees fahrenheit. Bottle at 65 degrees released a lot of carbonation upon opening but pour nicely. Dark brown with nice tan head that dissipated entirely after a few minutes. Smells of caramel and fruit. As this is an aged version of Pannepot, the flavor notes are much the same except more well rounded. Dark fruits, figs, and caramel come through mainly. The sweetness has subsided a bit from the un-aged version but in a good, melded flavor way. The alcohol is truly hidden at 10%. Again, mouthfeel is much like its younger version, bordering on stout like, but lighter flavor. A real pleasure to drink.

Color ebano con venature rossastre dalla schiuma color cappuccino e fine. Velo di schiuma longevo. Al naso si presentano note di frutta sotto spirito, amarena, cioccolata al latte e quercia. In bocca si ripresentano le stesse note con una aggiunta di caramello ed una leggera speziatura. I dieci gradi sono impercettibili. 
Un corpo ed unaroma degni di una delle migliori birre che ho assaggiato recentemente.
Meravigliosa!

Piana nieduża, sycząca, szybko znikająca do zera. Barwa rubinowa, klarowna, zbity osad drożdżowy na dnie butelki. Aromat intensywny, wyraźna dębina, wanilia, taniny, karmel, rodzynki, daktyle, brandy, porto, brandy... Super! W smaku powtórka wszystkiego, co zapowiadał zapach - delikatna taniniczna kwaskowość, słodycz suszonych gruszek, rodzynek, kandyzowanych fig potęgowana wanilią i karmelem. Goryczka niska, korzenna. W afterteasie kawa zbożowa i tytoń. Nagazowanie średnie, dość grube. Alkohol jedynie przyjemnie muska podniebienie, dobrze wkomponowany. Lekka szorstkość, nieznaczna cierpkość starego drewna na języku, treściwe ale gładkie w odbiorze.
Piwo oferujące całą masę doznań, bardzo dobrze przy tym zbalansowane i niezwykle pijalne (jak na 10% alkoholu). Leżakowanie w beczkach nadało mu dominujących cech dębiny i, w przeciwieństwie do agresywnie tytoniowo-palonej wersji bazowej, uczyniła je niezwykle aksamitnym, ułożonym trunkiem.
Dunkles sehr starkes bier mit geruch nach whisky! Geschmack erinnert an dörrobst! Angenehme bittere!

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2016 Bottle. Malty aroma of caramel, dark fruits, overriped fruits with notes of oak. The flavour is medium sweet and light bitter. Lingering taste of dark fruits with alcoholic notes. The body is full and the texture is oily. Soft carbonation. The balance is so good. A really nice and enjoyable beer.

Bière brune, au nez caramélisé et chêne et bourbon.
Au goût malts cara, bourbon, chêne et légèrement épicé. Coprs moyen un peu trop pétillante. Un délice.

Butelka. Barwa ciemno brunatna. Piana sycząca jak w coca-cola i znika bardzo szybko. Aromat intensywny, na pierwszym planie beczka, suszone owoce (rodzynki), czerwone wino, karmel, W smaku przyjemne nuty dębiny, ciemny owoców. Smaki fajnie zalegająca na podniebieniu.

Una birra da lacrime agli occhi. 
Si presenta con un colore bruno scura, carico. Schiuma color caffelatte non persistente.
Al naso e in bocca si sentono amarene sotto spirito e vaniglia, contornate da cioccolato al latte e noci.
Gusto equilibrato al massimo dallalcool che, nonostante si stia parlando di una birra da 10 gradi, non invade mai la bevuta. Frizzantezza vivace ma mai fastidiosa. Retrogusto eterno.
Backlog. 2009 bottle ->mini snifter from Churchkey Vintage Vault event. Dark brown with small tan head. Very complex, with caramel, sweet and dark fruit, yeast, spice, hint of booze. Delicious.

Color ebano con schiuma fine, cremosa ed aderente. Al naso complesse note di frutta matura, prugna, uvetta con sentori di vaniglia e pane nero. In bocca galleggia come la barca da cui prende il nome, morbida e sinuosa, lasciando una scia di liquirizia, cioccolato e ancora frutta matura e sotto spirito. Verso il finale fa capolino l'alcol con un calore discreto ed un retrolfatto di vino liquoroso dovuto alla permanenza in botti di Calvados. Il finale sorprende per la pulizia e le lievi percezioni tanniche.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 33cl, 2010 vintage. Poured in a snifter glass.
Pours a dark brown, almost black with a lovely looking two finger brown head.
I already tried the normal Pannepot which I enjoyed very much so I was looking forward to this Reserva. And boy oh boy what a treat this was...I didnt want it to stop! Absolutely divine Beergasm! What an improvement even to to the already great Pannepot. 
Aromas of raisins, black berries, roasted malt, nuts, vanilla, toffee, chocolate, coffee, cinnamon, cloves.
Taste is continuation of the smell with chocolate, vanilla, caramel, roasted malts, spices, dark fruits but with an addition of the oak and more wine qualities the aging did a clearly wonderful job. Full body, creamy, with a long lasting sticky finish.
This has aged wonderfully. I hope I can get my hands on a Grand Reserva because this would probably be the king of beers! All Hail De Struise Brouwers!

Anno 2010. In bottiglia da 33 cl. Colore marrone scuro, velata, schiuma marrone, fine e poco persistente. Al naso aromi di frutta secca, nocciola, legno, caramello, mou, ciliegia sotto spirito. Al palato corpo robusto, oleoso con sentori di legno, cioccolato, caramello, nocciola. Intensità alta degli aromi, birra ben legata nelle sue componenti, con ossidazione avvertibile ma che si integra bene con lalcool avvertibile. ottima
Nose is juicy rich plum and date. Medium body with a complex finish, lingering bitterness and dark fruit.

Bottle in a side by side comparison with the Grand Reserva, drunk in a tulip.
Thick brown head with long retention but no lacing. The aroma was intense right off the bat, with sweet malt notes. plums, dried fruit and a bit of alcohol. In the mouth, it had medium carbonation and body, dark brown color, and the taste was the same as the aroma plus a less well inserted alcohol than Grand Reserva, with a spicy and warm finish. These were my first Struise bottles and already made me a fan.

Robe brune, mousse peu abondante. Nez puissant sur le café au lait, le caramel, raisin de corinthe, vanille sur un fond minéral et malté. Bouche à lattaque tendue, belle rétro de café, fine amrtume, longue finale torréfiée et vanillée

Excepcional, notas a frutos secos, principalmente higo, ciruelas y pasas.

Color rojizo con destellos granates, cuerpo redondo, carbonatacion y corona de espuma baja.

Al paladar ligeramente dulce, muy frutal y deliciosa. 

Al paladar es una cerveza compleja, sin embargo oculta muy bien sus 10%, sus notas a frutos secos son intensas.
Gesmolten chocoladeijs. Dat is lekker thuis komen. Backlog from 2014/12/21.

Ruby brown pour with nice tan head. Lots of cocoa, rosey wood, and red wine on the nose. Lots of cocoa, some vanilla, cherries, and earthy oak at first taste. Finish like a fruity red wine, but the chocolate taste lasts from start to finish. A little sweet yeasty booze here and there but an extremely solid, balanced, and fantastic beer. Letting it come to room temperature it reminds me more and more of the original Pannepot. Sweet caramel spices like cloves and cinnamon. The Struise guys really out did themselves with this one.

Pours a brown shade of black with a beige head which soon effervesces away. Aroma is caramel, dark berries and spices. Taste is caramel sweet, spices, slight leather, vanilla sweet, molasses, slight raisin, touch of dark berry acidity.

0.33l bottle, vintage 2010. Very dark brown body, light brown head. Aroma of caramel, candi sugar, vanilla, oak, cocoa, plums and cherries. Taste of cocoa, vanilla, oak, caramel, plums and reisins. Definitely heavier (because of the oak character) than the regular Pannepot, hence quite hard to compare, but this one is also awesome.

33cl bottle (vintage 2010) from Vinmonopolet Stovner, Oslo. Pours clear, dark mahogany with a small, beige head. Malty aroma with lots of dried and dark fruits, caramel, licorice, some wooden notes, vanilla and hints of coffee, nuts and chocolate. Sweet, complex and flavourful, smooth, balanced and just delicious. Alcohol is noticeable, but well integrated. Excellent beer for a dark and chilly autumn evening.
Bottle at work. Pours Unclear dark brown with off-white head. Taste is malt, caramel, dark fruits, alcohol sweetness, quite intese, not my thing

2010 vintage bb 05/2019. Dark shoesole brown-mauvish pour, still fizzy, with quickly collapsing cola head. Mainly caramelised raisins and marmite in aroma, whiff of clove, Lebkuchen, speculoos and bayleaf. Minimals traces of Oude Jenever oozing through. - Starts off brown sugar sweet in taste, more dried caramel raisins and old dates, before going off on more complex savoury and even sourish tangents: fortified wine, vinsanto meet iron-y old filter coffee, loads of salty liquorish, cured wood and sauted mushrooms, a drop of fish sauce maybe. Both woody and chocolate bitter finish, with a salty sour edge. - Quite lively on the palate still, not nearly as unctuous and rich in the mouth as expected. Hence an easy sipper.

10%ABV. Belgian Strong Ale.

Poured out of the bottle a dark translucent brown. 35ºSRM.

Nose is sweet and malty. There are some nice fruity aromas of plums and prunes. Light almost candy-like sweetness. Clean and not cloying. There is a woody charactero the nose which reminds of a being in a skiff or the smell coming off wet pine.

The palate on this thing is just divine. Carbonated and well balanced. It certainly isnt light with a ponderous and well-formed malty base where you get black bread, caramel, burnt sugar, toffee, chocolate, coffee and other dark stone fruits like prunes and honey plums. There is a delicious date-like quality to the palate as well. There is a light brief peaty smokiness to the palate as well.

The finish is bitter hops mopping up all that sweetness and the alcohol. There is a creamy buttery finish that then transitions into something fruity and clean and then ends with a nice combo flavor note of oak and hops. If you close your eyes, you can even imagine some sweet tobacco.

For obvious reasons, Goes on Favorites List!
This is afterall the base ale that goes on to become the king of all beers for me now, the Grand Reserva.

Robe noir avec une bonne mousse beige. Arômes de chênes et de réglisse rouge. On ressent à peine le fort taux dalcool qui est bien équilibré avec le corps. Très bon, mais je mattendais à encore plus.

F: decent brown not long lasting.
C: dark, non-transparent.
A: vinous, cherries, cherries/plums fruit cake, vanilla, hint of oak wood, marzipan, rum, vanilla, dark fruits, hint of coffee, molasses, raisins, chocolate and many more
T: 2010 bottle, vinous, cherries, dry plums, raisins, chocolate, coffee, syrupy tones, figs, alcohol, cognac, vanilla, blueberry, some cocoa and many more, admirable complex Belgian Strong Ale aging in oak, full body, good carbonation, worth to try.

Colour of dark, shiny wood. Small coating of yellow / brown head. Lovely mouth feel - full and velvety. Aroma gently draws you in. Flavours are balanced and blended: malt loaf, vanilla cream, plums, dried fruit, red wine, oak, belgian yeast, chestnut, cherry. Top quality.
Aromas and Flavors of candied sugar, biscuit malts, spices and Belgian yeast. Brown sugar color with a pleasant and smooth palate. Complex and calming.

11-SEP-2015, 2010 bottle @Brussels appartment, from local shop, with Ulkløbben.
Dark, dark Brown with low tan head.
Sweet malt, Brown sugar, red wine, oak, dried fruit. Sweet, full body. Nice drink.

2010 bottle. Appearance- very dark, mahogany, a large cushiony light-brown head. Aroma- vinous, fruitcake, marzipan, Belgian yeast, cherry cake, vanilla, slight oakiness, toast, treacle toffee, molasses, rum and raisin, etc etc...Taste- fair bit of chocolate and coffee, roast malt, prune, raisin, plums, cherry, vanilla sweetness, hints of port, toasted coconut, brown sugar, malt loaf. Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy, leaving a nutty, dark-fruit filled finish. Just fantastic.
pour at struisespecial rserva margoux 2013cherry cola, grape must, rdcurrant, slick, low carbonation, sweet grape, caramel, winey finish.
Syrupy sweet. Oak. Tasted side by side with Grand Reserva. Dry. Yeasty. Tasted at my Whales and Whimps bottle share.

Black with a brown head - Sweet malt aroma with dark fruits and some woody notes as well - Dark malt body with dark fruits, wood, licorice and some alcohol heat - The dark malts goes inot a long sweet finish - This was real good

dark brown colour, minimal beige-ish head; complex aroma of plum jam, raisin, some figs, sour cherry-filled chocolate dessert, woody and herbal notes; taste of dried fruits (mainly plum and figs), woody notes, some cocoa, roasted sugar, minimal alcoholic spiciness and some herbal liqueur; perfect Belgian strong ale, Im fully amazed!

Couleur noire, mousse qui disparait. Nez caramel doux et cuit, fruits secs, fruits noirs, alcool rechauffant, boisé chêne, note de pommes cuites et leger chocolat. Gout puissant, rond et complexe, caramel cuit, caramel doux, fruits noirs (fiigue seche), fruits secs, pomme, malté, figues confites, noix huileuse, note de fruits rouges et un peu sucré chocolat. Fin bien longue et intense avec tout ces arômes. Magnifique! bref du Sruise!

2010 vintage bottled 11/2014. Pours nearly black with a creamy tan foam. Rich aroma of brown sugar, dark fruit, bread and yeast. Full body, creamy feel, soft/avg carbonation. Taste of burnt caramel, wood and licorice. Long lasting smoky finish.

Bottle, pours dark brown with an off white head. Raisins, caramel, candi sugar, dark fruit, vanilla, elderberries, hints of nutmeg, more spices. Sweet but not cloying, oily texture, medium to full body.

Beautiful dark colord beer. Tase is pure class! Dark fruits, alcohol, bitterness, caramel, raisins, liquor, roasted malts, red fruits. Nicely balanced. There should have been more oak flavours imo. Other than that great.

Dark brown pour, tan head that lingers. Aroma of rum, vanilla, dried fruits, caramel. The mouthfeel is sublime, very smooth bitterness and creamy texture. Loads of vanilla and raisin sweetness. High expectations met - outstanding.
Pours dark brown with a large tan head. Taste of dark fruit, slight smoke taste. Light carbonation on the mouth feel.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2015  Pours hazy deep brown with a huge light brown head. Aroma is wineous, roasted malt, dried fruit, raisins mainly. Flavour is soft malty sweet. Strong fruity and complex profile, really lovely blend. Alcohol makes a short appearance. Slight smoked note and soft malty caramel with a strong alcohol note in the finish.
Bottoe from trade or Binnys, I don't know which one, thanks? Poured black with min beige head. Aroma boozy oak dark fruits caramel. Light carb med bod. Tastes roasty char oak light bitter fruits.
Bottle from 2009. Tried with together with Grand Reserva and as spectacular as that was, this was even better. Vanilla cream! smooth. Yum!

Bottle from Saveur Bière (2010). Big, creamy, beige head. Dark brown body. Smells of sugar, yeast, apricot, vanilla, nuts, spices. Tastes vanilla, roasted coffee beans, apricot, yeast, chocolate, nuts, spices and oak. The oak aging is clearly in the taste, which Im not sure if its good or bad. I think compared to the normal Pannepot, it actually takes over some of the taste even though its still making it a bit more complex and full in its taste.

Dark brown nearly black body. Tiny brown head. Complew aroma, dried fruits, liquorice, candy sugar, oak and porte. Flavour is as complex, warm dried fruits, candy sugar, spices, red wine, oak. Long sweet porte finish with light bitter notes toward the end. Full body and medium carbo. Great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2010 Bottle drank at BBB3 procured from Stirchley Wines; dark chestnut brown pour with bubbly dark beige head, aroma is brown sugar sweet with a hint of Belgian yeast action, taste has dark, fruit, some spices, sweet caramel, not keen on this.

2010 vintage Bottle split two ways. Murky dark brown pour, small brown head. Aromas of oak and roast. Taste is sweet and lightly bitter. Flavors of oak, booze, roasted malts, sweet toffee. Cloying. A touch of oxidation. Finished sweet and syrupy. Meh.

A black body offers mahogany trim when illuminated, sporting a fading half inch of khaki head which settles to a solid ring

Eloquent, coating and cohesive... oak barrel, brown and dark fruit, molasses and honey coalesce to create a smooth, rich, very well nuanced experience with depth of complexity, exceptionally smooth and flowing transitions with solid intensity... coffee, blueberry juice, almond, macadamia nut, cream, brown sugar, maple syrup and pancakes, butterscotch, cola, a touch of raspberry... all on a creamy, silky smooth medium body with a touch of rounded, tingling carbonation to reignite all the complexities as the lasting residual forms and speaks... this is excellent

11.2 FL OZ bottle 2010 vintage served at 55º into 16 oz Sade Brandy snifter

2010 vintage. Boozy aroma with notes of molasses and oak. Opaque near-black colour. Flavours of dates, espresso, and honey with an oaky finish. Med-heavy body with lively carbonation. A rich, complex, and delicious beer.
2009 vintage at Kulminator antwerp tris with 09 grand reserva. Cola body . Butterscotch coca warm grain dried fruits caramel . Dark back nice lacing. Smooth soft palate . Fantastic beer

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2015 Reserva 2010 Lotto 130720032012.
Tonaca di frate con riflessi caramello, schiuma beige poco persistente.
Aroma di zucchero candito, acetico molto leggero, cacao amaro, uvetta, fichi, caramello, note legnose.
Al palato stesse caratteristiche, la gradazione alcolica è sorprendentemente ben nascosta anche se riscalda la bevuta in modo impeccabile.
Corpo medio, carbonatazione medio-bassa.

Dark cola brown two fingers of khaki head. Smells of dark fruit, Belgian yeasty, apple, a slight musty cocoa smell, caramel malt. Nice sweet dark fruit flavors, apple, a little cranberry, bit of nuttiness, oak. Smooth and fairly thin mouth, alcohol hidden well. Age has smoothed out the flavors to a nice even level. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Abbots Ale House in Cork. Pours a rich dark brown with a medium head. Great aroma off this, dark fruits like prunes, raisins and figs with chocolate, licorice and oaky notes. Same in the taste and also some vanilla and spice and nice sweetness and a little dry bitterness, quite complex really, lovely mouthfeel, gets better with with every sip, superb!!

Bottle, 33cL. @Palais_de_la_Bière, Poitiers. A shining black beer with brown hues ; medium beige head ; medium retention. Fruity aroma (raisin, fig), alcohol, toast, roast, chocolate, licorice, wood. Medium to heavy sweet ; rounded ; warming ; light dry. Full body, thin silky texture (no oily), average carbonation, sweet lasting warming fruity finish. Overall, a pretty mesmerizing dark belgian beer ; delicious ; good "wingspan".
Bottle @ Ølbutikken, Copenhagen 27/6-15. Chocolatey with dried fruits and banana, also some oak.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2016 Bottle, 2010 vintage. Almost black color, head quickly disappear. Aroma if roasty malts, cherries, chocolate, light coffee note, vanilla, red wine, oak. Taste is medium sweet, dry and light bitter at finish. Flavor of chocolate, vanilla, wood, cherry, bubble gum. Aftertaste sweet and dry, caramel, light alcohol note. Full body, velvet texture, soft carbonation. Not so good as i expected.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2015 0,33L bottle, 2010 vintage (from beergium.com). Pours dark brown with light brown head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, dark fruits, musky, cellar, some sour notes. Flavor is very sweet, malt, caramel, vinous notes, raisins, cellar, and some alcohol. Finish has some bitter burnt sugar. Overall: woah, great one.

Bottle @ Ölbutikken, Copenhagen 150627. [ Vintage 2010 ]. Fruity, malty and caramely with chocolate, dried fruits and some banana notes, sweet, full body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and sweet with dried fruits.

Piana jak na coca coli, na tym koniec minusów. W aromacie potężna beczka, drewno, rodzynki w wanilii, karmel, czerwone owoce, chyba lekka dzikość (infekcja?), piwo nie jest kwaśne, ale czuć obecność brettów. Gładkie, pełne, rodzynki i wanilia, belgijski charakter czuć w tym dziwnym brettowym posmaku, nie ma przyprawowości. Genialny aftertaste, dębina wręcz zalega na podniebieniu! Świetne piwo!
Sweet irony taste. Wow. Elegant. Thick. Oily. Spiky. Sweet dried fruits. A hint of roasted something. Very fine, indeed. Sophisticated.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2016 Birra fenomenale, molto simile alla sua sorella più giovane, la Pennepot. Personalmente trovo questultima un po più complessa, ma in generale sono simili. Direi che nella Reserva si percepisce un po di meno il Porto e un po di più il tostato e soprattutto la liquirizia...tanta liquirizia che è un piacere. Consigliatissima!

PANNEPOT RESERVA 2009 (assaggiata nel 2016 al Delirium): ASPETTO: nero impenetrabile, schiuma marroncino chiaro, abbondante, fine e persistente. AROMA: liquoroso, marzapane, caffè, cacao amaro, cioccolato, uva passita. GUSTO: tanto liquoroso, passito, Porto, prugna, marzapane, liquirizia, leggero caramello, caffè. Veramente un capolavoro!!!

Shared a bottle with a friend at the last BBQ, thanks Marc. Pours a dark mahogany with fiery highlights topped by a fizzy mocha head showing pretty good lacong. The nose is sugar cane, toffee, caramel, allspice, raisins and oak. The taste is in the same lane with a liquourish mouthfeel and decent carbs. Pair it with your favorite dark chocolate, its to die for. Cheers!

Bottle, Reserva 2010. Very dark brown, red reflexes, beige head. Aroma of caramel, molasses, dark and dried fruits, oak. In taste malty caramel, toasted malts, dried fruits, wooden notes.The beer is full bodied, creamy and oily in texture, alcohol very well hidden yet giving warming effect. Great beer.

Aroma: intense caramel, toffee, molasses, dried fruits, some oak / wood. Appearance: hazy, dark brown, small, beige head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: caramel, dry, toasted malts, heavy sweets, wooden notes. Overall: beautiful Belgian Strong Ale / Quadrupel, excellent flavours, well-rounded, outstanding drink! Bottle from BottleDog, Holborn.
Bottle at craigs. Pours deep reddish brown, nose is rich caramel, spices, vanilla, oak, taste is dry, spiced, vanilla, little harsh finish.
Bottiglia versa un colore marrone schiuma fine al palato gusto di frutta zucchero di canna. Forse la perfezione esiste.Dannatamente Buona
Bottle vintage 2010 from Bierhalle de Coninck, @ home. Quite similar to the regular Pannepot, maybe a bit more alcohol in the aroma. A great desert.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

0,33l bottle as a souvenir from my colleagues trip to Antwerp over New Years Day, 2010 vintage (best before 4/5/2019). Clear, almost opaque, very dark reddish brown to black with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, brown head. Pleasant, fruity-malty aroma of dark ripe fruits, cane sugar, nuts, a bit of coffee and some alcohol. Intense, sweetish fruity-malty taste of raisins, prunes, nuts and figs, accompanied by dark chocolate, a bit of coffee and licorice. Very long, warming and alcoholic finish with a bit of hops and lots of dark chocolate and coffee. Full body, smooth and creamy mouthfeel, very soft carbonation. Fantastic beer, although my palate does not seem to be sophisticated enough to detect the differences compared to the regular version. I can only taste a bit more alcohol and a heavier finish, maybe an increase in aroma.

Flaske 330ml fra Vinmonopolet, Tromsdalen. Svart. Høyt mokkafarget skum som daler ganske hurtig. Forsiktig aroma av mørke plommer. Oljeaktig munnfølelse. Behagelig, svakt syrlig smak - preget av tørr sherry & svisker. Alkoholen godt kamuflert. Litt bunnfall.

Bottle 2010 age on Oak. Nose is, as one would expect, pronounced oak, cola,licorice, plums, brown sugar, dark cherry, hint of mint. Taste is oak, cola, oak, dark fruit, treacle, cherry, raisins, slight vanilla, a little leather, there is a herbal note and a dryness despite the sweet notes. 

A delicious beer.

Bottle vintage 2010. Dark brown with mocha-colored head. Aroma of molasses, dark fruit and licorice. Taste rich and full.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Opis z wersji podstawowej (pozniej roznice) - Butelka, 2014. Piekny wyglad - przy nalewaniu zachowuje sie jak bardzo geste, lepkie, oleiste. Piana sliczna, kremowa, nawet lekko wpadajaca w czerwone odcienie, bardzo drobna, niezbyt wysoka. Opada niezbyt szybko, pozostaje cienka warstewka, lekko zostaje na szkle, widac tez bardzo delikatne lzy na brzegach pokala. Aromaty bardzo bogate, karmel, ciemne owoce (sliwki, wisnie, banany), suszone owoce (rodzynki, sliwki suszone), przyprawowosc dosc nienarzucajaca sie, zbozowosc, slodowosc, kawa, nawet czekoladowo-kakaowe nuty. Alkohol praktycznie niewyczuwalny. Smak analogiczny - wszystko to czuc. Praktycznie brak goryczki. lekkie rozgrzewanie gardla od alkoholu. dlugie, owocowe, kwaskowate posmaki (jedyny zarzut ktory mi wpada do glowy - zbyt kwaskowate). W ustach pelne, niesamowicie kremowe, gladkie. Bardzo niskie wysycenie. Na chwile obecna: najlepsze piwo jakie mialem okazje pic w zyciu :)W wersji reserva (2010, butelkowane 11/2014) o dziwo... kwasne nuty zarowno zapachu jak i smaku wyraznie bardziej wyczuwalne. Jest tez troche nut ktore mozna interpretowac jako pochadzace z drewna (kawowo-drewniano-gorzkawe), mile, nieco taninowe. Jednak sumarycznie lezakowanie de facto zubozylo palete calosci (zniknely np banany, karmel stal sie mniej wyczuwalny). Piana tez wyraznie mniej okazala. Bardzo dobre, ale tez wyraznie grosze - jak dla mnie - od Pannepota nie reservy.aktualnie pita butelka (2012) jest.. bardzo wisniowa :) na tyle, ze to dominujacy smak i aromat. fajne toOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

33cl bottle at home. Dark brown with a small tan head. Full body with low carbonation. Quite sweet with subtle bitter tones. Dark chocolate, roasted malts, caramel, coffee, ripe fruits, brown sugar, oak, spices and herbs. A great full flavoured complex brew.
