330ml bottle, 2010 edition, from house of trembling madness, York. Pours cola brown with a small bubbly head. Fruity nose with blackberries, strawberry and vanilla, the oak is palpable and there are some cocoa notes. Lots of flavours going on in this complex beer, plum and hazelnut come and go. The body is light medium, texture is creamy, finish is very nicely balanced, not bitter, the hops just round off the malt sweetness leaving a fruity lightly sweet aftertaste. Excellent.
Bottle. Dark brown / ruby with a thin off white head. Very similar to the base beer. Oak peeks out a tiny bit and sort of rounds out the beer. Very subtle but very tasty.

Bottle. Dark caramel brown and cola color. Light vanilla notes and oaky smoothness that is great but, mutes the dark fruits and spice of the base beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 23, 2015 Aromat słodowo drożdżowy. Barwa bursztynowa, klarowne. Piana drobna, krótka. W smaku ciężkie, słabo przyswajalne, lekko karmelowe. Być może moja ocena nie jest obiektywna, ale ten styl nie trafia do mnie kompletnie.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2016 Pours dark brown with fluffy head which dissipates after a while. Very nice complex aroma and taste of cigarettes, oak, smoke, berries, caramel, coffee, prunes, raisins, oak. Full bodied and very smooth. Lasting after taste. Superb ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with Bruce in his backyard. Pours brown with a thin off white head. Aroma is prunes and some figs. Thick and malty. Flavor follows but is surprisingly clean. Mild bitterness that is just right. Really nice beer and a great friend to share it with.

I have not tried the single pannepot yet. This is a very interesting brew with lots of aroma, harmonically fine tuned. Cask wood touch, port aroma is quite present. What I like the more are the roasted and cocoa flavours, with mild sweetness. Alcohol booze is significant.

Dark black with a short-lived beige froth.
Very intense: banana, prunes, dates, strawberry, chocolate. Coffee liqueur, molasses.
Powerful and sweet in the beggining. Mouth-covering as it slowly goes down. Good balance between sweet and sour in the middle. Very long finish with no bitterness. Hints of caramel, walnut, coffee and prunes. Excellent.

(On tap @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, April 9 2015) Pours deep brown with red highlights like cola, with a thin off white head. Aroma a bit port like with a brown sugar/toffee sweetness, touch of molasses even, stewed plum and a bit of raisin, berries maybe?, herbal, oaky, touch of chocolate. On the palate, rich but not overly sweet with toffee, toasted malt, dried dark fruits and berries, oak with a bit of vanilla/leather character, herbs, becoming nicely dry and even a touch mineral towards the finish. Hints of chocolate to go with the fruit/wood herbs. Faint tannic sort of bitterness in the long aftertaste. Medium full bodied with effervescent carbonation and a little alcohol heat. Supremely elegant beer, the oak character really meshes nicely. Lovely sipper, maybe a bottle with some age might be even better than keg, letting the alcohol smooth. Awesome as is.

Bottle of 2010 vintage. Pours dark chocolate brown, finger of off-white head. Aromas of brown sugar, molasses, caramel, spices, dark fruits, oak, some herbal notes. Taste is medium sweet, medium-light bitter. Alcohol is present toward the end. Medium body, surprising actually given aroma and appearance. Decent carbonation too. Really like the way the oak has added a level to this. The alcohol is just a bit more present than Id hoped, otherwise very good.
Clear dark ruby, no foam remaining. Nice warm aroma, smell port. Perfect taste, warm alcohol but smooth in mouth, palate explosion. (Velp 201504)
Toch één van de beste bieren die ik ooit gedronken heb, nog altijd spijt van dat ik er toen niet meer van ingeslagen heb.

33cl bottle, 2008 vintage. Pours a deep, cola brown color with a thin white head. Aroma is caramel, molasses, dark fruit, raisin. Medium on the palate with light carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, brown sugar, caramel, dark fruit, raisin, black cherry, with a sweet, malty finish. Excellent.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2017 Vintage 2010. Dark reddish brown oily colour. Aroma of dark fruits, plums, hebs and oak. Taste of sweet malts, dark fruits, slight liquorice. As usually alcoholic note is very well hidden. Overall complex delisious beer.

Bottle at home - dark brown colour with a reddish hue. Aroma and taste is sweet malty, caramel, brown sugar, chocolate, dark dried fruity, yeasty, some wooden nuance on the palate, nice spices, lovely.
33cl @ bottle. Credo di preferire la versione standard della Pannepot. Buonissima pure questa, ma tanto vale bersi laltra che è pure più economica.

July 31st, 2013 - This is my first Panneport Reserva 2005, and comes hot on the heels of other beer celebrities at the epic beer tasting party from July, 2013. My friend Kepano donated this tiny treasure, for which I am very grateful. After many years of aging it makes its final departure from the bottle with a cloudy, murky brown appearance, with clear layers slowly swirling up and down like a sepia aurora borealis. And from this potion comes scents of almond, milk chocolate, cream and heady, rich custard. Like many exquisite Belgians it is at the same time dry and sweet. The flavor balances precariously across both the dry and sweet spectrum too, imitating the rich fan of flavors one kinds in skillfully brewed quadruples. A sampling of the tastes present include light pear, dusty wood, a moderate alcohol buzz, red grape, and a long, rich umami deep aftertaste with some of the bordeaux grape note lingering on the palate. 8 years in the bottle has given this brew some real meditation time, and I think the result is a lovely bouquet and flavor medley that won over all our hearts at this celebratory beer event.
Bottle. Deep brown color with a medium sized foamy beige head. Aroma of raisin, chocolate, oak and vanilla. Sweet taste with a medium bitter finish. Medium body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

5.12.2014. 2010 version. Very dark brown, oily. Aroma is spicy, plenty of dark fruits, plums, warmth of alcohol. Taste is quite full, sweet malts, dark and fried fruits, slight liquorice, warm although alcohol is well hidden.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2015 Bouteille 330ml, 2010, gracieuseté de tom10101, merci Tommy! Couleur brune très foncée opaque, mousse moka fuyante. Arôme de malt grillé, boisé, alcool, fruits séchés, prune, dattes, touche de levure et de madérisation. Goût de malt caramélisé, caramel foncé, sucré, alcool, figues séchées, café en arrière-goût. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen-dense, collante.

Very dark brown, bordering to "shady red black" colour. Head dissipates not so quite quickly, but thats normal for a beer with such ABV. 
On the nose: dried figs, raisins, caramelised sugar, chocobananas, molasses, some alcohol, spicy, bramble jam.
Taste: caramel, dried fruits, some alcohol, some tannins, complex, smooth, a hint of chocolate. Sweet, but still very balanced. A very good one.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2015 Mørk brun med lavt skum. Aroma av vanilje, belgisk gjær, sukker og tørket frukt. Smaken er sukker, tørket frukt og vanilje, muligens litt konjakk og treverk. Søt. Medium konsistens. Perfekt karbonert. Mildt bitter i ettersmaken.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2015 Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ XXXII The Great Power of Beer & Wine.
A: Dark brown / Marron oscuro.
T/S: Malt, raisins, alcohol, sweet / Malta, uvas pasas,alcohol, dulce

-2010 vintage- Dark red with tan head. Aroma is Belgian spice, licorice, oak, cherry and some licorice. Slick palate. Aftertaste is spicy, fruity, dry, oak, floral, licorice and dark chocolate. Overall: Excellent! Well made!

33cl bottle enjoyed @ home, 2010 vintage. Pours very dark brown, almost brown with a small offwhite head. Aroma is yeast, malty, caramel, candied sugar, oak and some raisins. Flavour is sweet. Medium bodied, sticky , soft carbonation. Finish is sweet with dark fruits.

2010 bottle. Great beer! You can certainly feel it is a Pannepot, but there is an smooth added tone of vanilla, and a little wood. Compaired to the original beer, i also seem to find a little roasted coffee-like taste.

Bottle. Pours dark slightly murky brown with a small offwhite head. Aroams of alcohol, burned sugar, dark ripe fruits, raisins, oaky dry notes, some licorice. Taste is following, lots of fruits, some malty notes, toast, light spice, some licorice, dry woody finish.

Bottle. Pours really dark brown with rube shine and small beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, toasty malts, brown sugar, fruity, prunes, raisins, slight oak and some wet tobacco as it warms and more belgian yeast. Taste is really well balances, not overly sweet. Malty, toasty, dried fruits, brown sugar slight oak, Finish is fruity and rather dry with som oak and pleasant booze. Medium to full body and very drinkable and dangerous.
2009 edition @ home. Beautiful dark brown beer with a very thin head. Strong tasty small. Taste like chocolate and mokka. Great beer.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2015 2010 vintage. Pitch black color, thin off white head. Aroma of malts, overripe fruits, hint of strawberries. Taste of malts, red fruits. Nice smooth texture, thick and oily. Alcohol is nicely hidden so thats nice. Very good.

2010 bottle. Pours black with light brown head. Nose of licourice and spices, smooth in the mouth, a mere hint of its strength. Malty and rich with a delicious aftertaste but does lack a character of remembrance. Its good, very good, but lacks that final zip of uniqueness.

2009 vintage. Pours black as night with a creamy mocha head. Heady sweet aromas of port wine, sweet tobacco, oak tannin, licorice, toffee and stewed dark fruits. All the notes from the aroma are present in the taste, if a little more subtle in some respects. Spicy and light-medium bodied - lighter than expected but works to help avoid a cloying finish. 10% ABV is extremely well hidden. Really great beer that will linger in the memory.

Deep brown to ebony black pour, thin light brown head dissipates fast. Licorice, dark berries, vinous notes. Oily thick feel, full body, low carbonation, carbonation balances, malty and sweet, raisins, alcohol present but not as disturbing, long finish is lively. Tasty, nuanced, balanced, lively, great one.

330ml botle, v2010, at home, bought from the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Dark brown color with red notes and darke beige nice head. Aroma is malty and yeasty, dark dried fruits, wineous, caramel - sugar, light roasted malty notes, spicy, alcohol and wood. Taste is sweet and bitter very similar to the aroma, little more caramel - burnt sugar. Medium oily-sticky body with soft carbonation and bittersweet caramel fruity finish.

Dark red, dark brown, slightly hazy, with a nice beige head. Aromas of alcohol, malts, caramel, roasted notes, some spiced notes, maybe burnt sugar. Taste is sweet, spicy, oak, wood, burnt sugar, caramel, raisins, some plum, alcohol notes on the taste. Full body with medium carbonation.

Bottle at home, 2010 Vintage, 27th February 15. Poured dark brown, aroma is sweet, brown sugar, slight liquorice, spice. Taste is accomplished, complex, molasses, malt, spice, liquorice, oak. Sweetness is balanced by the booze. Medium carbonation. Good complex Belgian.

Vintage 2010 from Belgian e-shop

Dark black color with red hue at the side of the glass, thin, light brown head, medium lasting. Aroma of molasses, sweet caramel malts, spicy oak notes, some biscuit/bread crust too. Taste is sweet, dark malts, some spice, apple juice, molasses, hints of oak. Finish is light bitter from the roasted malts and just a hint of tannins (from oak or dark malts), lasting. Slightly dry, very low carbonation.
Another excellent beer!

Reserva 2010 bottle to a tulip. Watching the Oscars 2015. Pannepot is a favorite and this version does not disappoint ... Dark fruit and spices with sweet toffee malts and an oakiness on the finish ... Exceptional.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2016 February 15, 2015 Rating - 2010 Vintage poured into a taster showing coffee brown rims, dark center and no head. 

The nose shows a lot of brown sugar with hints of molasses

The palate shows soft carbonation and medium bodied. Moderate -t high big brown sugar/caramel-malty sweetness with a moderate alcohol spiciness in the middle. 

January 3, 2016 (2009 Vintage) - Poured into a teku showing translucent brown with light sparse white foam swirling.

The nose and palate show a lot of the same although quite balanced. Im raising the rating on this one.

0,33д l, 2010. Dark brown with garnet color, tan foam. In aroma sweet grandmother brandy mixed with spices, dried plums and gooseberries, apricots and raisins, caramel and toffee. Taste: sweet bliss old honeys, nectar with dried fruits; hops, oak and good old port in finish, very warming. Great ale!

Cellared 2008 11.2 oz. bottle poured to a goblet, displaying a rather clear, coppery brown color, with a presentable layer of brownish tan head foam that gradually diminished to a bubbly film & silky ring, leaving clingy dots & dashes of lacing on the glass. The nose was some roasted character, with a touch of cocoa, but mainly dark fruit as prune, cherry, concord grape, and raisin, with caramel sweetness, and a sherry-like scent. The flavor was malt sweetness, continued esters, a mellow amount of oaky & tanniny bitterness, a bit of tartness, and sherry-like alcohol whose warmth built slowly throughout the taste. Softly carbonated, but possessed a smooth & rich texture, and medium to full body. Aged very well as quite a long awaited treat!

Pannepot reserva 2010. Stappata la bottiglia rimango perplesso....ma appena messa nel bicchiere inizia lo spettacolo! Di color scuro, riflessi rubino, con schiuma beige cremosa, che si vedrà sparire non poco più di 2/3 minuti dopo. Al naso salgono sentori di frutta rossa e caramello. Al palato un esplosione di sapori, che con la sua leggera carbonizzazione, lo rende morbido ed elegante. Ad ogni sorso viene voglia di berne un altro....una meraviglia!

Pannepot Reserva 2010, uitgeschonken in 33cl. De Struise bierglas. De kleur is net als bij de 'normale' Pannepot diep bruinzwart met een donker beige schuimkraag, die terugzakt tot een fijne roodbruine schuimring. De geur is intens: gebrande mout, koffie en gedroogd fruit. De smaak nadert de perfectie van bier, werkelijk ontzettend smaakvol. De smaken zijn als bij de 'normale' Pannepot, maar dan meer intens, vooral meer eikenhout. Schitterend zacht smaakpallet van geroosterde mout, koffie, karamel, specerijen, gedroogd fruit als rozijnen en dadels, kruidkoek, chocolade en eikenhout. Het mondgevoel is haast romig, door de densiteit en vrij lage carbonatie van het bier. De afdronk is lang licht houtig en zacht bitter door een mooie hop balans. De Pannepot Reserva is werkelijk het beste bier tot nu toe wat ik heb geproefd. De Reserva 2010 is nog iets complexer dan de reguliere Pannepot en een meesterlijke batch van de Struise brouwers. Een product waar België trots op kan zijn!

Notes: 2010 vintage
Colour: Deep brown with copper, creamy beige head.
Nose: Spices, sweet coffee, ripe fruits, apple notes, lingering.
Flavours: creamy texture, apricot, plum, raisins, vanilla, herbs, caramel.
Finish: long, creamy soft, intense.
Verdict: Amazing aged ale, rich and intense. Masterpiece.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2015 Reserva 2010.Color marron- ambar oscuro. Espuma beige muy poco persistente.Aroma a licor, caramelo, malta tostada, algo de cafe, ciruelas,barril...en boca muchas sensaciones muy buenas , dulce, chocolate, madera...el final larguísimo... Birroteeee. Y eso q las Belgas no me van jajajaja

Zwarte kleur, de kraag is snel vertrokken. Ruikt in het begin metalig maar als het bier wat opwarmt dan ruikt het zoetig, drop, likeur, wat fruit. smaakt ook behoorlijk zoet, mout, likeur. weinig koolzuur, medium body. Ruikt complexer dan hij smaakt.

330ml bottle. pours a very dark opaque brown with quite a tanned head. aroma is oak, slightly smoky, molasses, caramel and burnt sugar. taste is syrupy with soft carbonation. warming alcohol, oakyness, coats your tongue in smooth toffee and fruits. nice 1000th beer.

03.01.2015, 0,33l bottle (2010 vintage) @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is kind of neutral, yeast, oak, grass, dark malts, alcohol, candied sugar, banana. Taste is very mild, almost a little neutral, candied sugar, yeast, grass, oak, dark malts, alcohol, raisins, minerals, caramel, banana. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Fair enough, just a little boring...
Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Smells of rye, malts and vanilla. Tastes of rye, malts, honey and caramel. Average carbonation, medium body and a sticky texture.
Lovely quad!. Sweet, berry, rich. There are coffee and plums on the palate, excellent!

Poured 2008 from bottle to glass. Dark hue with tan brown head that dissipated to a ring. Aroma is prune, caramel, tobacco, plum, belgian sugar. Mouthfeel is nice with a medium body and crisp carbonation. Taste is sweet with a slight ethanol finish. Overall this is a fun brew.

33cl bottle. Deep black colour with a very thin tan head. Caramel, dark chocolate, raisins and port wine notes in the aroma. Soft carbonation and full body. Taste is hard to describe, since it is so suave and so balanced but at the same time so complex and so rich. Like a very old vintage port. Overall, a must have for any beer lover.
Bottle shared with hakes, wowsers, didnt realized when I grabbed this random gem that it was a 100/100 beer, and it shows! flavor galore !!
Dark Brown beer with a big dense off white head. Aroma of malt, caramel and ginger cookie. Soft well balanced flavour of malt and dark fruits. (Bottle 33cl 2009)

33cl bottle from 2010, aged in bottle over 2 years probably. Dark brown pour with no head. Aromas.. Malt, cognac, apple peel, caramel and chocolate hints. Taste is pretty toned down comparing to fresh draught Pp, but offers a slight boozey experience with watery afterdrink. Tastes like dates, a little sugar cane and tiny bit bitterness.
Poured from 12oz bottle from Blackwells.. Prune raisen and grape notes. Smells like red wine. Plum and notes of chocolate. Complex and delicious.

Pours a dark brown with a thin fizzy offwhite head that rushes away and leave few lacing. Nose is raisins and plum, caramel and candi sugar. Wow. There is an incredible depth to it, I could smell it all night. Taste is moderately sweet and has a light vinous edge. Flavors of caramel, raisins, chocolate and oak. Body is full and carbonation low. A lot of wood and tannins but its all positive here. Almost no alcohol heat, amasingly drinkable. Awesome!
Aroma with a hint of red wine. Its taste takes a while to give all its shades in the mouth.
Très bon palais, le goût arrive par étapes. Bière crèmeuse, peu houblonné. Goût composé de plusieurs saveurs bien équilibrée entre elle.

Bottle brought back from Bruges. Poured a really dark brown/ amber, with a big, dense off white head. Lovely aroma of prunes, raisins, dates, Belgian yeast, spice and malt. Complex flavours, some port, molasses, candy sugar and nutmeg. Finish is perfectly rounded; smooth dark malt, caramel, dark rum and booze soaked fruit. Its a classic.
Bottle 33 cl of 2010. Dark brown wit small light brown head. Sweet bread aroma. Sweet taste with some sourness followed by dry caramel bitterness. FRuity notes in the taste.

Bottle from Sterk Avondverkoop Amsterdam.
Pours dark with a small head. Aroma-wise I smell a dark maltiness, mild but pleasant. The taste is dark, complex, every sip is different. There is really a lot going on here. Considering its 10% strength it doesnt taste overly strong. I dont notice much of the oaking. Overall this is good beer. Much better than e.g. a Rochefort 8 or 10.

I had it first in Kulminator in Antwerp and I was like "God created beer and called it Pannepot Reserva" The Aroma is not very strong but the taste is amazing. Pannepot Reserva rocks comparing to regular Pannepot and Pannepot Grand Reserva Vintage.

Tried the Pannepeut, Pannepot, Reserva and Grand Reserva on a wonderful evening in Bruges. Like the Goldilocks fairytale, the Reserva sits in the middle as a perfectly balanced beast. Delicious, and better than WestieXII imho.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great as all pannepots. Had the 2010 reserva. Dark brown with a small beige head and soft carbonation. Flavor is wonderfully complex and well balanced. It is strong and sweet but not boozy nor overly sweet. Flavor is vinous with calvados, dried fruit, roasted malts, coffe beans and marzipan. Every time I have a pannepot I am surprised. Somehow you remember it is great but you never remember the exact flavor.

Black beer with head going to the sides. Aroma has dried fruits, tannin, berries and cream. Taste has berries, cream, tannin, nuts and plums. Full body and medium carbonation. Complex Belgian strong ale, as usual, but very good.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2014 2010, 4 years old, pours a cloudy dark beer with a big brown head with regular retention, aroma is moderate to heavy sweet and low bitter with dark fruits, dried fruits, caramel, clove and oak, robust bodied, smooth, great balance, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and low bitter and sour with a bittersweet finish and a medium aftertaste, very good
Bue en bouteille. Excellente bière, du corps et de la complexité au palais. Fruits rouges, alcool et malt.
A beer which refers to perfection. Incredible palate, brilliantly wonderful taste and there is not a single beer quite like it. Top 10 material.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2015 330ml bottle served in a chalice. 
A: Pours a deep amber to brown color with many particles floating around. Forms a medium solid beige head with medium retention. However it never disappears completely leaving a thin creamy layer on the top. Some thin lingering and molasses lacings are formed and left in the glass. 
S: Very sweet and fruity upfront. Strong notes of caramel malts and candi sugar, dark chocolate, vanilla, licorice and coffee. Oak. Roasted malts and earthy yeasts. Light notes of grassy hops. 
T: Sweet upfront taste. Quite malty and spicy. Notes of caramel malts, roasted malts, candi sugar, licorice, dark dry fruits, dark chocolate and coffee beans. 
M: Full body. Creamy and molasses texture. Medium to low carbonation. Caramel malts and dark dry fruits in the aftertaste. 
O: Excellent drinkability. Close to the regular Pannepot but smoother and less boozy. Masterpiece. 
[ BA Review @ 10/17/2009 ]

Draught at Ölrepubliken 2014-10-11 Göteborg
AR: caramel toffee, roasted malt
AP: black, stouthy créme beige steady head, lovely curtains
F: carmel toffee, a bit sour coffey, oaky vanilla, round soft body, great sipper beer

Mörkt i lokalen men ölen verkar svart med ett brunt skum. Doft: Kaffe, päron soda-piggelin, exotisk fruktsallad, kola, kola, cola, lakrits, kakao, bröd (karlssons fyrkant), äng. Smak: Kola, cola, kanderat socker, kanderade nötter, frukt soda, örter, fat, lite bourbon, lakrits.
Sample @ a tasting event. Dark brown body with a medium tan head. Chocolate, dried fruits, spices and burnt sugar.

Struise Pannepot Reserva 2009: Sötétbarna teste fölött csinos bézs színű habköntös húzódik, csodás külleme magával ragadó. Időnk azonban alig van csodálkozni, illatai ugyanis hamarosan még magasabbra teszik a mércét. Lenyűgöző aromáira számíthatunk ugyan, mégsem lehetünk felkészülve egy ehhez hasonló kavalkádra: cseresznyebefőtt, rumos meggy, csokoládéjégkrém, tölgyfás füstösség; maga a csoda... Ezt követően pedig már nincs megállás; tejszínes alapokon csúsznak a fűszeres kávés, konyakmeggyes, krémes süteményes zamatok, likőrös fürdőt vesznek a vaníliás-kókuszos ízjegyek, majd egy perzselő zárás pecsételi meg az összbenyomást. Ez utóbbi persze nem az alkoholfok testet öltésére értendő, mert az teljesen beleolvad a környezetbe, szinte észrevétlen marad. A Struise ezt egyébként is mesterfokon űzi. Ezt a főzetet lényegében bármely típus királyának kikiálthatnám, ez esetben legyen a belgian strong ale kategória mindenkori dobogósa.

Barwa: ciemna, pod światło rubinowa, lekko zmętniona. Piana beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, średniej wielkości, ładnie oblepiająca szkło. 

Aromat: początkowo nieco, drewniany i lekko waniliowy. Jednocześnie kwaskowy i alkoholowy z akcentami rodzynek, czekolady, kawy, karmelu, ciemnych słodów oraz cukru kandyzowanego. 

Smak: zdecydowanie pełny, dość słodki, z czekoladą, rodzynkami i kandyzowanym cukrem na czele. Następnie bardziej wytrawne, jakby palone akcenty i niewielka goryczka. Alkoholowa końcówka, nieco ogrzewająca przełyk. 

Młodszy brat Pannepot Grand Reserva 2009. Tym razem piwo jest "jedynie" leżakowane w beczkach dębowych. Nie ma zatem nuty winnej i nie jest tak alkoholowe, jak poprzednik. Mamy natomiast więcej nut słodkich oraz wzmocnionych ciemnych słodów, które były uprzednio bardzo łagodne, przez wpływ leżakowania w beczkach po Calvadosie. Nie twierdzę, że piwo jest złe, ale faktycznie jest nieco inne, jakby mniej aksamitne, a bardziej toporne. Czy to źle? kwestia gustu, bowiem także jest ciekawe, ale nie wyróżnia się już tak na tle innych belgijskich mocnych ale. Zbliżoną ocenę zawdzięcza głównie pianie, natomiast za taką cenę z pewnością po raz drugi nie kupiłbym tego piwa. Z drugiej strony warto wspomnieć, że seria Pannepot znalazła się w książce "1001 piw, które wart spróbować", zatem może jednak warto ;)

Bottle courtesy of bytemesis, thanks Mike! Pours a murky brown/copper, golden/rust colored hues. Minimal eggshell head. Aromas are very delicate, with brandy sweetness, dark fruit, spice/yeast and light oak. Taste is more pronounced than the aroma. Waves of molasses, dark fruit, notes of apple brandy, oak and cereal. Light spice and roast couple with a lingering sweetness. Incredible balance to this...and incredibly smooth in the finish. Great beer!

33cl bottle. Pours dark brown with a moderate beige head. Superb and complex aroma with notes of chocolate, dark fruits, caramel, spices and a heavy sweetness. Flavor is heavy sweet again with notes of chocolate, dark fruits and light coffee. Yeasty and coffee aftertaste.
One of the best gets better. Bottle shared by Rich from 2008 series. This one aged very well, still as smooth and slick as butter. Dark dried fruits, yeast, typical Belgian ale but oh so tasty.

"more similarities than differences in the Pannepot, Reserva, and Grand Reserva, and that after having all 3 side by side...and different years of each. This was a 2009...all 3 are among my favorite belgoan beers. Ill take any of these over a Westy or Bernardus any day. Mellower on the carbonation and yeast, rich and smooth. Dark fruit abounds. Excellent!"

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2014 2009 33cl bottle. Pours dark brown with two fingers of beautiful creamy beige head. Smells of caramel, molasses, dark (plums, raisins, dates) and dried fruits with some alcohol chocolate cake aroma. Taste adds toasted note with coffee, burnt sugar, light spices and some alcoholic and liquor-like flavors. Excellent.

Vibrant light Cola brown, ringed eggshell head. Creamy hardware clove and cherry. Initial taste of clean tinny bitterness, furry tart toward the middle. Clean and complex. Drenched sweetness and easy on the barrell finish.Bottle, Independence Tasting, from the Garvie Cave

In bottle (vintage 2010): pours a dark brown. Aroma of malt and fruit, with some cocoa. Taste is similar with coffee notes added .. very good coffee though I am finding all the Pannepots are tasting the same .. good thing they are good beers

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2014 2008 bottle. Cloudy brown, tiny offwhite head. Aroma has malt, fruit, vanilla and port. Flavour is similar, sweetish with brown sugar, clear notes of oak later on. Alcohol is definately present, but well controlled.
Bottle shared at Cardinal, Stavanger. Bottle labeled "2010". Pours dark brown. Aroma of raisins. Cant taste the difference to the "normal" Pannepot.
Shared bottle at Mi2 15.09.14. 2010 vintage. Almost black. Pale brown head. Herbs, liquorice and alcohol in aroma. Decent taste, also with dark chocolate. Quite carbonated.

Bue en bouteille de 33cl au Sherwood Pub (Nicorvo) couleur brune, peu de mousse et effervescence quasi inexistante. Bouteille estampillée 2009. Grosse attaque sur le caramel et le fruit rouge continuité sur le grillé et la noix grosse tuerie.

Coffee bitterness, chocolate, light alcohólico touch, some grain, leathet, subtle resin and raisins. Wood, subtle bitterness. Spicy.
Taste starts sweet chocolate with a full oily feel. Creamy and nutty. Evolves info fizziness, with souwood and leather. Alcohólic, fizzy sweetness. Saltiness. Dry clear finish. Beautiful balance.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2017 The first barrel aged version of Pannepot, (originally) of limited production; matured on Saint-Emilion wine barrels for 14 months. It boasts the same incredible complexity, finesse, tempting bouquet and greatness as the regular Pannepot and more, with the emphatic oak tannins and vanilla adding a considerable amount of additional complexity. Dried fruits, sweet tobacco, sherry, bourbon, walnuts, calvados, woody tannins and a touch of balsamic vinegar are all there - and very intelligently blended.  I especially liked the 2009 vintage at six years of age, with a wonderful vinous character and vanilla tannins; the 2008 in comparison was already a bit thinned by age and less pronounced, but still very complex and enjoyable.

Pours a dark brown body with a thin head. Aroma of bread, burnt candy and wood. Very rich taste with all the malty flavours you can think of.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bière ou merveille, merveille de bière en tous les cas.
Quadruple de 10% abv, définie par le brasseur comme une « old fishermans
ale aged on oak ». 
Couleur plutôt marron extra foncé que noir (bien située par le brasseur comme
une « hazy dark brown ». Opacité totale.
Mousse dun café expresso, joli nappage crémeux (creamy beige).
Arômes de malt torréfié, fève de cacao, chocolat Lindt noir 75 %, whisky
Macallan 15 ans, fruits secs, pain 7 céréales.
1ère bouche veloutée qui est un pur plaisir concentré, une anthologie en elle-même.
Arrière-bouche large, vaste, que dis-je  gigantesque, avec du café, chocolat,
malt et levure.
2ème sur un ensemble fruits secs/bois/candi avec une fine pointe de cookie.
3ème bouche, comment dire  tout est dans ce breuvage : fruits, bois, malt, épices, levure .. et un équilibre strictement diabolique...
La longueur donne des milliers dimpressions gustatives supplémentaires, qui en font presque un monde de science-fiction !!
La levure est une veine sidérante, fine, soyeuse, un rien dépice dOrient en
direct.
Lalcool : quelle valeur en soi pour soutenir pareil brassin, une force colossale,
mais il assume parfaitement.
La finale est un pur nectar venant de la marmite des dieux.
CONCLUSION : il faut dire dabord en préalable que coter cette bière sous la 
cote de 4,7 est une ineptie  (cela fait quand même 63 personnes sur 880
qui sont du bon côté de la balance !!!). Ceci dit, pour moi, cest la grandeur
des grandeurs, la splendeur des splendeurs. Son altesse la Sérénissime Pannepot dans sa version mûrie en fût est tout simplement un sommet de lart
brassicole. Un pur absolu... la texture est divine et le brassin paradisiaque.
Pour mon 555 ème rate, je peux ainsi donner un 555 sur 100... Cest magnifique, comme dit Arno... Elle rejoint ainsi son amie la St Amatus !!
(au paradis évidemment!)

The colour is like a dark chocolate. Huge light brown head but it dissolves quickly. Theres roasty malt flavour and liquorice also. Hints of caramel and lots of undefined spiceness. Warms up the throat quite fast. Good beer but maybe just my type.

this is the 2008 version. Poured a seriously dark brown with a quickly disapating head. Big heavy aroma of date and fig and belgian goodness that puts a smile on my face. Carbonation is perfect with this one and it really coats your palate. Flavor is very sweet with the same fig/date flavors sprinkled with some spicy notes, maybe nutmeg, lasting long after you finished. I really liked this one.

Wow. Has aroma of dehydrated plums, cherry and a bit of port wine. Its dark, non-transparent. With amazing beautiful head. The head looks like it was nitro carbonated. In taste - honestly, I was speechless. There are notes of plums, chocolate, cacao with a note of port wine. In mouth it feels highly carbonated. Its very drinkable cuz alcohol is unnoticeable. The body is rather small and thin.

Noire collet tres fin belle dentelle.
Des aromes de folie reglisse cafe du bois fumé. 
Onctueuse en bouche, bien ronde avec un final boisé. 
Un regal

33cl thanks to ruigo. Thanks for this beast! 2010 bottle. Color is dark dark. Head is thin and brownish. Body is medium, light carbonation. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium bitter. Aroma is roasted, malt, caramel, coffee, fruit. Its very good, but I was expecting even better!

Bottle, 2010. Hazy dark brown with a medium-sized lasting beige head. A rather powerful aroma with sweet malt, woody barrel notes, both fresh and dried fruits notes (figs, raspberry) and spices (clove, cinnamon). Complex, inviting. The flavour is smooth, sweet, fruity, and dry. The dryness comes from the barrel. Warming alcohol. A really very complex and lovely beer.
(Backlog) Bottle. Dark pour with some head. Dark fruits, some oak, and sweet aromas. Flavors are rich and complex, fruit, spice, some other malts and oak/wine tones.

Pannepot Resrva 2010 : bottle from saveur-biere.com

A brown robe with a tint of ruby red. The head was deep beige. On the nose a strong aroma of prunes, apricots, candy sugar, toasted wood, figs and hints of French pain de epices. On the mouth, it begins with a burst of candy sugars followed by dried fruits, roasted nuts(almonds), tasted wood and hints of english fruit cake(plums and cinnamon). The finish is long with an after taste of figs and candy sugar. This is a complete whole meal beer. Excellent brew.

2009 vintage.
Similar to the Grand Reserva (or is the grand reserva similar to this haha). Fruity and roasted nuts in the aroma and taste, goes down great, however I thought the Grand Reserva was just a tad better.

Bottled 330ml. -from Magic Beer Room, Zagreb. Almost black coloured, medium sized brown head, caramel in the nose without any alcohol notes. Roasted malt, licorice, caramel and dried fruits with mild woody notes. Mild spices and alcohol in the finish. Decent brew, of course.

12oz bottle (2010 vintage) pours dark toasted brown black with small thin head and tons of floaties. Nose is fruity plum, grape, earth, wet soil, touch of roast, multi grain bread. Taste is creamy smooth mouthfeel, red grape, grape jam, plum, some subtle roasty bitter chocolate notes. Finish is more of the same with lasting roasty fruit, dark grains, some vanilla. Complex and nice.

Bottle at delirium. Pitch black with a small beige head. Leathery aroma, dark stone fruit. Full body, roasted dark fruit flavour. Fantastic. 2009 vintage. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2007 Vintage.
Dark brown, almost black with a small creamy beige head.
Aroma is sweet, caramel-y with vanilla, raisins and bourbon.
Taste is sweet and spicy with vanilla, raisins and figs.
Full body, low soft carbonation, velvety smooth.
Short dry after taste.

Completely dark body, small tan head. Brown sugar, oak, caramel, some alcohol. Chocolate finish. Full body, thick and creamy texture. Soft carbonation. Interesting and very well indeed.
(Magic Beer Room 0,33l bottle)

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2014 Dark brown color with beige medium-lasting head. Aroma is like the regular Pannepot, but much more intensified, ripe fruits, figues and raisins, chocolate, toasted malts, hazelnuts and spices are present. Taste is not as intense as the regular one, but is sweet, with toasted malts, caramel, cherries, plums, vanilla and spices. Very balanced, with well integrated alcohol. Dry finish, with coffee hints.

Bottle: 2010. Thanks, Ryan. Deep, deep brown, outlined with a ruby edge. Burnt khaki foam softly rests on top. Aroma of steely, toasted caramel malt, lots of residual sweetness & burnt sugars, a touch of must that almost hints at oxidation. Some dark fruit. First sip is full of sweet brown sugar & toasted caramel candies. Toffee, deep layers of macerated prunes & raisins. Hints of anise, molasses, & burnt sugar. Warmth brings out a mild phenolic character. A touch of floral & fruity esters in the finish along with a heavy burnt toast flavor that lingers. A decent beer, but I just dont "get" this one, I guess. Liked it, didnt love it.

Bottle 2010, exp. 04/05/2019. A very dark brown beer with a weak and beige head. The nose is complex and very enjoyable. Lots of dark fruits, prune and dates, some raisins, also fresh strawberries, herbal hops, also wood and dry barrel with vanilla, hint of alcohol. Taste has lots of dark fruits, prune, raisins, strawberries, strong herbs, drying wood and barrel with hint of vanilla in the end. Similar taste and aroma. Medium bodied, mild carbonation, fresh even that strong. Great beer. Complex, creamy, smooth and incredibly balanced.

Bona cervesa, es bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, es bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.
12oz bottle of 2010 vintage. Pours a dark brown color with not much head. Caramel and mild spice. Complex well balanced fragile flavors.
Shared at RBSG 2014. Dregs but chill lots of fruit and such. Taste is dried fruit and raisins. Nice and smooth.

2009 bottle. Deep dark reddish brown colour, beige foamy head. Nose is big on acidic wine tones along with creamy malts, brown sugar and red fruits. Taste is also big on wine notes lingering on in the (dry) aftertaste, with creamy malts, vanilla, dried figs and dades and red fruits, gingerbread, clove and other spices, chocolate, brown sugar/caramel and coffee: complex, too say the least. High alcohol grade is indeed well disguised. Medium bodied (regular Pannepot is better bodied i.m.o.), low carbonation, soft and oily mouthfeel.

whoa!! 2010 bottle to glass thanks to ClarkW!!! aromas is complex but sugars and overripe fruit is what stands out. great palate and color. Taste is complex - the dark fruits, much brown sugar - but it is never cloying; spices, yeast, wow!! great stuff. Thanks Clark!!!

11.2 oz bottle is 2010 vintage. Gusher for about 5 minutes. Pours a chestnut brown with a thin beige collar. The aroma offers dark malts, brown sugar, raisins. Smells nice. Great flavor and remarkably easy to drink. Alcohol hidden very well. A tad sweet, with lingering notes of plums, figs. Another great beer from De Struise.

Fat märkt 2012. Mörkbrun dimmig öl med ett lättare ljusbrunt skum. Doft av torkad frukt, fikon och trä. Trä och taniner kommer fram ännu mer i smaken. Kryddig och bra fruktig och mörkt socker sötma. Komplext men drickbart öl.

Flasche (33 cl), Jahrgang 2010, gekauft im Struise-Shop in Brügge. - Tiefstes Schwarzbraun. - Der Geruch ist etwas eindimensional: viel mehr als Rosinensüße und eine verlockende fruchtige Alkoholnote rieche ich nicht. - Der Antrunk dann eine Wucht: schwerstes dunkles Malz, Rosinen, Mokka, Bitterschokolade, Lakritz, perfekt austariert durch zart säuerliche Fruchtigkeit. Sahniges Mundgefühl, fast ölig. Sehr dicht und reich an Aromen, wie konzentriertes Bier, aber von vollendeter Harmonie, weich und rund. Das Etikett spricht von Ale brewed with spices, aber keins der Gewürze drängt sich so in den Vordergrund, daß man es benennen könnte oder daß es störend wäre. Noch im Abgang bittersüß, dann leicht trocken; holzig-herber Nachtrunk. Der hohe Ethanolgehalt macht sich, obwohl deutlich präsent, nicht störend bemerkbar. - Phantastisch, ein Ausnahmebier.
Bottle, 2010. Drank this side by side with a 2011 non-Reserva. They are really quite similar, but the barrel character and matured flavors take this one to a slightly higher level. Really delicious!

bottle shared by minderbinder, thanks brah! pours hazy dark brown, red tint, with a minimal light beige head and some lacing. spicy dried fruitiness soaked in brandy-like oakiness, raisins, tobacco, bit of dirt, sweetness - finger-licking brown sugar, spices and molasses. lively to average carbonation, light to medium body - oily, never too sticky, assertive and astringent grassy-herbal-peppery-spicy finish. very good - but i still prefer regular pannepot and pannepeut.

From a 2006 bottle at Zeebra II.
Dark brown colour, a bit hazy, with a thin brown head on top. Good retention, light lacing left behind.
Aroma of red stewed fruits, a bit of vanilla, prunes.
Taste of red and dark fruits, some spices like cardamon and light coriander, again some vanilla mainly on the finish, heav on caramel.
Medium body, carbonation with a bite, dry feeling on the palate.
Overall a quite tasty beer, highly drinkable, makes you return for another sip.

Bottle 330ml. [2010]
Pours very dark burgundy with low beige head. Minimal lacing. Aroma is of caramel, fruits, toffee, malt, some oak. Taste is of caramel, fruits, molasses, roasted malt, alcohol, bitterness. Palate: Sticky texture. Full bodied. Low carbonation. Overall: Loads of fruits in there. Pretty complex.
A beer that make empty your mouth.Chocholate,liquorice over all. The best of his category in my hopinion
Backnote, had this beer at the zeebra extreem beer festival 2014. superb beer
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes dunkelbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig, röstig, dunkles reifes Obst. Geschmack röstmalzig, stark malzig, überreife Früchte, Karamell.
Bruine chocolade kleur met weinig schuim. Ruikt vanille, crème, drop. Smaakt stroop, drop en vanille.
2006 bottle. Pours a dark brown beer with a tan head. Smells rye, malts and vanilla. Tastes rye, malts, honey and caramel. Average carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.

Doft av katrinplommon, mild smak av russin, bränt socker och rostat kaffe. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared by esp0r with me, Simonsen & Edvard, september 28th 2013, thanks a lot! Dark brown, redtinted, with light brown head. Aroma of toffee, cocoa, prunes, spices. An ever changing comples taste starting with coffee and dark sugar, going through dark chocolate, berries, raisins, pine, pepper, bready malt. Excellent and a joy to experience. Alcohol is pretty well hidden for a 10%, still giving a warm feel towards the end, where the beer feels more fruity together with hints of oak. This is one of the beers that just make you smile. I love it!

Shared 33 cl bottle. Pours dark amber with a small head. Lots of cloves, grain and sweet raisins on the nose. Taste is biscuits, light yeast, grains and dates. Nice and smooth mouthfeel and light on the carbonation.

2010 bottle, consumed 16 Mar 2014, Solidly aged flavor, slight hint of oxidation which is not offputting yet, but any more and it would be.. I love the taste of aged pannepot normally, and this is no different the aging on oak doesnt impart as much flavor as I would have thought, almost a drying type finish but not much else.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2014 Spina @ cantinetta.
Scura con schiuma fine e persistente.
Molto spessa, carbonazione quasi assente.
Sapore deciso di uvetta e di torrefatto.
For a 2008 vintage, this has held up remarkably well. A sweet bread aroma and taste with a wonderful burnt caramel flavor with vanilla. Really impressed with this one.

A magnificent Belgian ale. 2009 version. Pours a beautiful deep brown with wispy white head and sediment. Aromas are a bit metallic at first... but open to sweet dark dried fruit.. Raisins and prunes, dried apples and bubblegum. Flavors are sweet bubblegum and more dried fruit. A nice bitter oakiness rounds this beauty out. Very good.

Flaske, 33 cl, Ørsted Bar. Årgang 2008. Mørkebrun, forholdsvis frodig beige skumkrone. Kapow-næse. Appelsin, nødder, peber, sherry-noter, træ. Fyldig, stor og kompleks smag. Mange lag. Cremet struktur. Tørrede bær, abrikoser, honning. Lang, lang eftersmag.

2008 Vintage.
Ar: Plum, leather, rasin - a touch of sherry - rum and white pepper.
Ap: Murky brown - tiny off-white head with poor retention, leaves a foam ring and rare wisps on the top.
T: Deep raisin and brown sugar - peach, plum, treacle, a bit of nougat - warming alcohol, but exceptionally clean - subtle, complimentary oxidation - low bitterness, a bit of mossy hop flavor - toasted malt and fig on the finish.
P: Full body with medium-high carbonation - finish is medium.
O: Rich and complex dark Belgian strong ale - delicious mix of fruit and dark sugar - substantial and warming, but very eloquent, not harsh or hot.

Bottle: 2009 vintage
Pours dark, rich brown with a thin tan ring.
Raisin, baked bread aroma.
Sweet, raisin, toffee, chocolate syrup flavor.
Dark fruit and warm dark bread...wood...
The barest of alcohol prescence....
Really wonderful.

WE INTERRUPT THE OLD REVIEWS TO BRING YOU #1000!

330mL bottle, 2009 vintage.
Polish off the old La Trappe chalice; kinda wish I had something a bit more la-de-dah, but itll do.
So what are we looking at, thats what were here for afterall...A deep, near-opaque bronze/mahogany coloured beer, thats what. Holds a small creamy tan cap.
Shes a bit shy at first to let her true odour to be released, but Im patient...its taken over 11 years to get to this point afterall...
Decidely vinous it must be said; black plums and blackcurrant esters, combined with medium-toast oakiness, woody spices of clove, nutmeg and black pepper, and a hint of vanilla. Add to that a good fat dose of burnt caramel and bitter chocolate maltiness, with emerging aged notes of raisin and honeyed fig.
A sipper for sure; you have to give a beer of this strength (and quality) your undivided attention otherwise youll end up rather intoxicated..
She sits laid out length-ways on the palate; long, sustained, has a smooth, syrupy quality, if only abruptly, thwarted by creamy bead, leading to an almost velvet-like sensation, not that Ive ever consumed velvet orally.
With all of this considered, one would assume she would be quite a sweet beer, but you know what they say about assumptions... But it does indeed start off with a decent helping of biscuity, treacle-y, cake-y, pudding-y sort of sweet malty goodness, but we digress and lead on from that portion of the entertainment to much more pressing, complex things. What things you may ask? Well how about woody spice, like cloves and mace, or perhaps throw in ripe figs and plum skins, and maybe, for a limited time only, nutty port-like rancio. Thats right; its all there. A good peppery punch of bitterness balances, but by no means dominates. A kiss of warmth from her boozy breath and she is finished.
Such a shame to lose her; why one bottle Muggus, for shame. 
Anyhow, lovely beer, truely. Worthy of an 1000th, or even 10,000th, if we ever get there...cheers!
Pours black. Light brown head. Smells of raisins, malts. Taste similar. Dried fruits. Prunes. Medium body. Was a gusher, but still nice. 2009 batch

Bottle, Vintage 2009. Pours dark maroon, with a finger thick creamy, mocha head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, nuts and whiffs of oak barrels. Full body with soft carbonation. Flavour is quite fruity malts, with cocoa and prunes, as well as oak, leather and tobacco giving a lingering dark fruity finish.
Tap. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is slight whiskey, sweet. Tase is extreme fig, plums, vanilla, a flavor explosion. Absolutely amazing!
On tap @t Antwaerps Bierhuyske. Dark brown with a beige head. Some sweetness, caramel aroma. Taste raisin, some bitterness and a little sweet.
Bottle (2009). Brown sugar and orange/raisin bread malt and light alcohol aroma. Dark chestnut with small head. Sweet raisin bread, oak, and alcohol flavor. Toasted bread finish. Delicious.

2010 bottle picked up on my recent Portland trip and rated Feb 2014.
Deep brown pour with a nice tan head into my tulip glass. The aroma brings oak and some unexpected smoke, gingerbread, dates and prunes, cloves and other spices rising from a warm loaf of banana bread straight out of the oven, a quite prominant metallic note that smells like a bloody lip tastes (to my surprise, I see that I noted the same thing in my review of the Grand Reserva five years ago). The flavors are sweet but not cloyingly so, quad-like. Dark fruits, spice cake, juice from black cherries, the same oatmeal-raisin cookies that characterize the base beer. Dark caramel. Ricola cough drops, but not in a bad way. A hint of cola, a bit woody with hints of pear skins late. Alcohol becomes apparent as it warms. Resinous hop bitterness very late, like the aftermath of an imperial stout. Beautiful creamy mouthfeel, very little sign of the heat until much later deep in the throat. The age has done well by this one and I dont think it has started to fade. Exceptional beer.
Mørk brun farve med beige skum. Lukt av malt, karamell og frukt Smak av malt, karamell og frukt. Import.
Duft av rosin, krydder og lakris. Tynt lag skum, hengende langs kant. Mørk brun farge. God smak av rosin, lakris, krydder, plomme og andre frukter.
Différence avec la Pannepot classique (dégustation des deux versions coup sur coup): moins aggressive en bouche mais plus darrière gout.

2009 bottle - Pours a very dark brown with reddish orange highlights and a dense tan head. The smell is roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruit, brown sugar. The taste is chocolate, licorice, dark fruit, roasted malt, a touch of alcohol ending dry and roasty. Medium/full body with a fine carbonation structure that is smooth and elegant. This is a very nice beer an perfect as and after dinner drink.
Excellent beer. All the tastes and aromas of pannepot just a little more subdued. Tastes of caramel, oak malt. Same chewy mouthfeel with moderate carbonation.

Sample draft @ BAB14.
Brune foncée, col beige léger.
Arôme est typiquement belge avec un beau bouquet fruité noir, note caramel, grillé pointe boisée et de chêne.
Palais également fruité noir, fort complexe, malté caramel, pointe de date et figue sur ce fini levure typiquement Struise. Pétillant est léger avec un boisé que je trouve un peu trop discret.

Bottle, vintage 2009 @ t Brugs Beertje, Brugge. 4.9.2013.

Practically opaque dark brown beer with a thick beige head. Aroma reveals beers oak barrel aging immediately. Theres the oak, some cognac. Also heavy maltyness. Sweet malty flavour with dark fruits, oak and cognac. Full body hides the ABV very well.

Thanks Phil Penny for this 2009 bottle. Bottle to snifter. Pours cherry mahogany in color. Almost no head. Light on the carbonation. 
Beautiful plum filled nose with a hint of some berries. Brown sugar and malty! Not bad at all.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2016 Draught. Hazy deep brown liquid with minimal white head. Aroma of dried fruit, chocolate, licorice, pumpernickel, red berries and toffee. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of toffee, dried fruit, raw sugar and chocolate. Medium bodied with low to medium carbonation. Quite nice. 

Rerate two days later. This is fucken awesome. The perfect dark Belgian strong Ale. Such complexity. Very taste.

Bottled 2010. Reddish brown dark pour. Small but substantive head. Nose is raspberry and some yeast and plums. Taste is same but some roasty malts and candy sugars. This is a great beer but I?m not quite sure why its so hyped. Its good- great even- but I don?t know.

2008 bottle from GothGargoyle thanks a ton man! Sampled side by side with a 2007 (not infected) bottle of the regular. Pours a dark murky brown a little bit darker than original. Nice white head that dissipates, and leaves a nice pattern resembling our fine province. Aroma - sweet brown sugar notes, a bit of herbal maybe? Surprisingly the aroma is muted compared to the 2007 bottle that smells like a fine sherry. Taste - sweet sticky mouthfeel, some bitterness, candy sugar, plumb like notes, with a semi sweet/bitter finish. The 07 is much more pronounced and rich in flavour for sure a lot of oxidation but it works well. The 08 reserva is very good also, a very different finish, less oxidation, with a more hoppy (bitter) finish, some subtle spice is mixed in but I dont really pick up on the oak and overall the flavour is a bit muted compared the regular. Two very different beers. But both very tasty I like the regular better.
Draft at Uber in Seattle. Gorgeous, still brown. Rich with small head. Deep, soft fruit, slight medicinal. Red grape, ruddy tannin. Sweet sip, terrific.

2009 bottle. Brown Carmel pour. Somewhat boozy sweet Belgian Carmel aroma. Taste is Belgian spice, oak, some banana. Had this after the regular 2011 and bought the regular was better. Still pretty tasty.

Black-bodied, but not much head. Figgy and dark fruit aromas immediately shine through and are soon followed by sweet figgy flavors, dark fruit, and just a pinch of sherry depth. A solid brew, but rather on the sweet side.

Snagged this bottle off a shelf at Dawsons in Severna Park, hiding behind some other brews while home for the holidays. 2009 bottle poured to a Unibroue tulip on 1/9/14. The bottle says only 3,000 bottles of this made. Not a bad find! Pours a murky dark brownish purple with a small off white or khaki colored head. Beautiful aroma of plums, super ripe pears, raisins, tobacco, toffee, chocolate, brown sugar, lots of beautiful mellow oak with a nice helping of booze that makes me almost think this was bourbon barrels. Flavor of raisins, plums, brown sugar, some warming booze, light cocoa, toffee, tobacco, and much more spice than would be expected from the aroma. The oak dries out the finish a bit and keeps this a very smooth and mellow brew despite the alcohol and spice present. The mouthfeel is heavy, like huge imperial stout heavy, and yet has low to medium carbonation. This was pretty freaking awesome.

Vintage 2009. Belle couleur brune foncée avec des reflets bordeaux, fine mousse brune. Nez très riche, baies noires : mures, cassis, cerises griottes à leau de vie, chene, vin rouge, sucre candy. Très puissant en bouche : résine, chene, raisin, banane, le corps est lours, liquoeurx, lalcool est bien. La longeur en bouche est exceptionnelle. Larome comme le goût sont très complexes. Une très grande bière.

2009 bottle. Pours a dark mahogany and carbonated nicely leaving a fine layer of foam that floated on the surface. The aroma is of sweet sugar, fruit, weak carmel, hidden booze, crystal malts, spices, and mild oak notes. A very pleasant aroma. In tasting I noticed a sweetness from the malts and fruits. I picked on carmel malts, light licorice, weak acidic tones from the fruit, mild bitter cocoa, and very weak booze. The finish was sweet, malty, and acidic. A very drinkable beverage. Overall a great brew.

small frothy fizzy light brown head. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. flat thick dark amberish-brown body. aroma: moderate malty, dark chocolate, mild coffee, prune, ruby port, alcohol. if: heavy sweet light acidic. ff: moderate sweet light acidic light bitter; long duration. palate: medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation, moderate alcoholic finish.Espuma se torna cremosa após alguns instantes. Maravilhoso sabor de frutas secas, predominando uva-passa. Dulçor maltado, leves toques de chocolate. No final do gole, sente-se uma saborosa acidez que lembra a que ficamos após comer uma ameixa vermelha fresca. É também perceptível a presença amadeirada no paladar, proveniente do envelhecimento em barris de carvalho. Espetacular cerveja, esconde bem os 10%. Sua acidez no final do gole também lembram taninos de vinho tinto seco, menos forte que um cabernet, talvez um carmenère. Tal acidez começa a aparecer durante todo o paladar bem no final da cerveja, quando a mesma já ganhou temperatura, conferindo a ela novas nuances, de frutas vermelhas frescas. 350 s

At my parents after opening Christmas gifts. Pours brown murky. Aroma is dark fruits, darks moth Belgium fruit, taste is fruit, caramel. Taste is nice dark fruits, very smooth very warm. Beautiful Christmas sipping beer.

2010 330ml bottle. Duvel tulip. 60 degrees. Minor gusher. Black pour. Thin tan head. Lovely aromas of dark fruit, red licorice, vanilla and spices. Very elegant, balanced palate, with very fine, super creamy carbonation!! Wonderful mouthfeel!!! Alcohol is completely integrated. Flavors of dark, dried fruit, figs, prunes, sweet tobacco, cola, brown sugar, caramel, molasses, ripe banana and spices, elegantly linger on the palate for minutes!! Concentrated flavors, yet very refined and elegant overall.. Great stuff! Mmmmmmmmm.... Don't pass this up! For the style, this is near the top of its class, if not one of the best. Simply awesome! I want more... a lot more.

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2014 Became hooked on this beer to drink a sip. Taste that I do not think 10% alcohol content probably because you are allowed to settle firmly a sweetness like chocolate in a gorgeous fragrance. This beer will enjoy the temporary best to drink on the night of the cold winter.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2016 Drank a large 2010 bottle with Thijs on 25-12-2013. Awesome beer. Almost no foam. Very rich chocolate, coffee taste and hints of sweetness from the barrels. Alcohol taste is present. Magnificent.

Edit: rated slightly lower, have had this beer several times over the past years (for example 18-4-2016 while writing in my diary).

2010 vintage. Pours very dark brown to black with a larger khaki head that settles quickly to a ring and film, leaving a few spots of lace. Nose involves dark cherry and grape notes, brown sugar, some mild oak. Really sweet, a bit tart, and fairly bitter. Full bodied, soft carb, oily, chewy, with a lengthy toasty and fruity finish. A nice brew, but somewhat underwhelming. Not much oak influence as I could tell, overly sweet, and not quite as complex as I had hoped.

Vintage 2008

A: pours a dark brown ale with very limited clarity. Two fingers of graham head falls to a sheet of the same. Spotty lacing.

S: Graham, cinnamon, nutmeg, butter. Some yeast, sweet malts. Not incredibly complex.

T: wow, aromatic in the oral cavity! Super duper herbal. Alcohol, buttery malts, nutmeg, cinnamon, grain. Woody flavors are really raw. 

M: Heavy body with moderately high carbonation. Resinating finish is semi dry and viscous.

O: Really complex beer here. The nose doesnt impress, but the flavor and mouthfeel are nice.

Serving type: bottle

07-15-2011

Concerned I might have gotten a bad bottle. 2010 vintage. Maybe these have already peaked. Pours light brown with minimal light tan head. Scent is bready and faint. Taste is not complex and somewhat bland sweet and grain flavors. Going to try the standard Pannepot of a more recent vintage. I was really excited to try this and am left trying to figure out what happened. Bottle - The Porter Beer Bar - Atlanta, GA

Batch #4, 2009 versie, zwart met zeer fijn bruine kraag
aroma van gebrande mouten, zoet, zuurtje, vanille en donkere fruiten
smaken: redelijk zoet, licht bitter, zeer sterk, redelijk moutig, matig kruidig, banaan, rozijn, caramel, iets van taart/deeg, lichte port/rode wijn, vanille, gedroogd fruit met mooie moutigheid
volle body, romig in de mond, lage co2, perfect gebalanceerd ! super bier

Famous beer with a strong dark fruit aroma that also features wood smoke, soy maybe, and something menacingly medical and boozy. Dark brown sludge appearance, wont retain a head for long. Sweet, savory smokey malt taste. Seems like it could be very sugary but is balanced out by its strength and aging-added flavors. Equal parts mellow and intense. Thick palate cloaking body. Dry, papery after effects. Very effective big brown ale, although I didnt think the original Pannepot could be improved upon, and still feel that way.

on draft poured a darkish red/brown color with white head. I let it sit for a moment and just stared at it...the aroma of some spice, oak, malty sweetness and I believe 2009 vintage. the flavor was so evenly balanced that I didnt want to share with my guest but I did and they all liked. the oaken spice blended with the roasty malts was incredible. this is a special occasion beer and well deserved.
Nose is quite medicinal, acidic. Maybe whine-like? Doesn't smell like Pannepot. Taste is absolutely brilliant, amazing balance between sour, roasted, and yeast. Even better than Pannepot

Cant believe Ive never had this until now. 33 cL bottle -- 2010 vintage -- poured into a wine glass. Deep dark amber pour with an ecru head. Brown sugar-covered dates with a smattering of tart berries and a touch of concord grape on the aroma. Flavor gives an initial burst of ashy chocolate, quickly tempered by wood and raspberry seeds before finishing with a roasty tobacco flourish. Body is well-aerated, light and moussey but not thin, no real alcohol presence.

09 bottle from tiong. Thanks, man! Dark caramel brown, lots of sediment. Initially nose had some sherry and mushroom oxidative notes, but quickly became deep burnt caramel and soft oak. Deep caramel flavor and characteristic belgian fruity yeast elements. Sweet finish. Terrific example of the style.

Year 2010.
Black body, nice fluffy brown head.
Aroma has roasted malta, molasses, dark chocolate, spicy coffee, bit acidic, herbal medicinal hops. Flavour has all above things, but adds some ashy coffee and floury yeasty chocolate. Bit flat, maybe lack of carbonation. Roasted and balanced, just an excellent treat.

Slightly hazy very dark black. Sweet dark fruits, strawberry jam, very ripe banana. Then dark cholocate, tabacco, leather, wood, burned toast. Thick mouth, almost sticky, light fizzy carbonation. Sour finish. This is really heavy stuff, outspoken but complex. Slightly too much for me, but still very good.

An aroma of figs and dates is faint until some modest level of warmth is achieved. A nice sweet syrupy palate that helps the flavors of dried fruit and smoke linger long after. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2014 15.9.2014 Vintage 2010 at Cardinal. All the characteristics of the original rating with the addition of vanilla on the nose, malty notes and alco warmth in the mouth. Most enjoyable. Retaining the original score.. 26.10.2013.Vintage 2007. Shared 330 ml bottle at Holmen1. Clear mahogany body with a light brown rim. Dried dark fruits, raisins, figs and dates. Sweet, vinuous, fruity and well balanced. Full bodied. Smooth. Long fruity finish.

Flaske på RB samling hjemme (takk til Asle Bjørn): intens aroma av svisker, rosiner og alt du kan ønske deg. Kanskje finnes Elysium allikevel. Et snopeøl i absolutt særklasse til å dele med din beste venn. Vann, malt og gjær - at det kan bli så godt!

Shatred bottle at local tasting. Vintage 2007. Pours dark brown, clear with a small tanned head. Deep malty aroma, fig and musky malts. Taste is sweet, thick malty, complex and a perfect beer for rounding off a long evening of a good beeer tasting with friends, full bodied, soft palate. Halleluja.

On tap at brewery into snifter. 

Appearance: dark black, slightly brown. Tan head. Beautiful.5 

Aroma: spicy, fruit, chocolate, oak. 

Taste: on the sweeter side. 

Palate: very nice mouthfeel. Rich texture. Long finish. 

Overall: really really nice beer. Very complex. Ever drop was delicious.

Had on draft at the Avenue Pub .. . pours a deep murky barky brown .. . medium foam, stopped up lacing .. . bring a sweater .. . very large beer, plum, prune, wet wood, and grape liquor .. . . very boozy and lacking any subtle qualities, to messy for me .. . . Face down, catsup.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2014 Bottle, 2007 version. Dark red with a tan head. Has aged beautiful very different from the fresh one. Aroma is chocolate, figs, raisins, vinous, caramel, oak, light spicy. Taste is sweet dried fruits with caramel and a light chocolate bitterness. Smooth full bodied and soft carbonation.


Original rating (Oktober 12, 2013) 
On tap at SBWF. Pours dark amber with no head. Aroma has dark sugars, dried fruits, oak, cherries, fruity sweetness. Taste is light bitter with chocolate, red berries, caramel, light acidic. Light sticky sweetness and a touch of acidity in the finish. 
8-4-8-4-16=40

2009 11.2oz bottle drank September of 2012. Deep opaque brown-burgundy body. Thin beige head, fades into an oily top layer that rims the glass. Sweet and rich, this is definitely World Class. Brown sugar, caramel, toffee, oak...very nice. While it is big and rich, there is also a lot of finesse, the oak really complementing the big malt tones. Nutty toffee oak tones, delicate mouthfeel, with a hint of bitter dark liqueur, As good as it gets, great beer.

Bottle labeled 2009 shared with Simonsen, edvard & daje
Pours dark red with a big tanned head. Smells of prunes, raisins, dark fruits, hints of caramel, a touch of oxidation and malts. Heavy sweet, dark fruits, dried fruits, caramel, toffee, oak and malts. Moderate bitter finish. A very excuisite beer; it got alot of vinous qualities and a nice oak touch.

10/9/2013. 12 oz. Bottle at the Farmhouse Tap & Grill in Burlington, VT. Pours dark brown with a short white head. This is the 2009 version. Aromas if dried fruit, malt, spice, alcohol. Oaky flavors with fruit and alcohol in perfect harmony. Thick and syrupy with a semi sweet finish,

(4/20/13) 09 Vintage. The nose is bourbon soaked dark fruits - beautifully blended - with a hint of green apple. A bit of spice too. Any oak seems to have faded however. I would have liked the nose to have been stronger, but I imagine that age has subdued it somewhat.

The taste is really subtle and complex. Anything that may have been dominating or overpowering in this brew was quelled by four years in the bottle. Again, bourbon soaked dark fruits. Most of the heat of the bourbon is gone leaving a smooth, slightly woody bourbon sweetness. Theres a tannic, slightly sour (in a good way) quality that manifests near the finish.

The mouthfeel is super smooth. This brew goes down dangerously easy. There is a nice pleasant warmth in my chest and a bit of burn at the back of my throat.

What a wonderful brew and simply a pleasure to drink. Easily the best bourbon flavors Ive tasted in a brew. However, Id imagine the regular Pannepot has more overt complexity because barrel aging tends to dominate my palate.
Flaske fra esp0r. Drukket på hytta til dag. Rødbrun farve. Tynn skumrand. Lavt karbonert. Brun sukker,karamell,mørke frukter. Svært fornøyelig
UPDATED: JAN 7, 2016 Wonderful brew with mostly sweet fruits, caramel, vanilla and softening tannins from the wood. Very complex and subtle.
